content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												Quite a neat little polished game. Basically it's an open world sandbox in the vain of Project Zomboid. You start off in a bunker and go exploring to find food/water and other supplies. Along the way you'll meet friendly NPCs and settlements, as well as enemy raiders and of course Zombies. You can recruit other NPCs to follow you (and become playable characters), and eventually establish your own settlement wherever you like really. This settlement can be built up with walls, houses, towers etc. Inventory management plays a big part in this game with some tasks taking a while to complete without having large backpacks equipped on your characters. You can automate tasks by telling your characters to go collect wood/water/other supplies so in a sense it has an RTS element too as this is all controlled from a top down perspective. Combat is simple yet functional with bullets being relatively scarce, and the enemies are quite varied with raiders being tough to kill while zombies are cliched being simple in small groups but quite difficult in hordes.  There are way more features I have not touched on but if you want a really pleasing survival game with a pick up and play aspect to it, then Survivalist is that!

Like to tell your survivors to only use weapon if they absolutley need to or something.  If they are very hurt...2.The dialogue is very repetitive. content:
Posted: March 31
												Yes, the game's graphics are quite outdated and the gameplay mechanics make it feel more like a simulation than a survival game. However, while waiting for State of Decay 2, this game makes an excellent coop experience at an affordable price. The controls are awkward and the HUD is poorly designed, but these are minor issues that can easily be looked past once you start getting into the game. Ultimately, the game features a massive map, plenty of content, an actual story, decisions, as well as elements of both RTS and third-person shooters.If you're into survival coop games, this is certainly one worth picking up if you have a friend with similar tastes.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2016
												I never wrote a review here before, but this game is truly a hidden gem! The gameplay is a very satisfying blend of rpg and strategy (I found it somewhat reminiscent to the Jagged Alliance series). But in this game, the world is much more open-ended and realistic. For example, it seems as though it is theoretically possible to recruit almost any NPC to join you by making certain decisions and using certain items. After the initial, classic-rpg small-group portion of the game, you also start to build your own town, complete with shacks, outhouses, defenses, and corn. The balance of finding items to survive early on and eventually having to make your own is very well done. As you start to manage a larger group of survivors you can also make use of automated commands such as "collect materials", "farm" or "guard" that give portions of the game a sort of apocalyptic Sims feel. In terms of gameplay, I found fighting zombies annoyingly hard, but using auto-combat mode basically turns it into more of a pure strategy game. Fighting other people, though, the computer interestingly does not do so well, so I manually control my survivors then. There are a few weaknesses I'll list below, but overall this is the best $3 I've ever spent and I hope the developers will produce many more games in the future!Pros: Great blend of rpg/strategy, gritty and realistic post-apocalyptic environment, recruit many survivors, build you own town, multiple endings, nice survival balanceCons: Graphics are a bit simplistic, some NPCs look the same, zombies bite too much unless you use auto-combat, no way to fast-forward through sleeping or resource collecting, music is just alrightOverall: Great indie game, one of the best I've ever played, highly recommend!

												This might be my favorite survival experience yet, way better than State of Decay. This game is definitely a gem, if the graphics we're better, I would assume the game would have more attention. The thing is, the graphics never bothered me, and the user interface didnt matter to me after a few minutes of playing.1. Game has a story arc to follow if you want to. 2. Open sandbox allowing you to influence every nearly character in game to join you 3. Building.4. RPG elements5. Decent A.I.6. Complex relationships, meaning each character has a level of respect and or approval of you. 7. Many realism factors.. Guns kill people 8. You can strafe to use cover.9. CO-OP!!!Suggestions for future development: 1. Randomly generated maps for replay value as the game mechancics here are very well done. Not sure how easy that would be. 2. Some sort of deplomacy script. I someone how got caught stealing crops despite grandma coming to my base to talk while her man was in the house asleep I took some corn to plant at home, or a person on my squad was a member of a looter community which angered grandma, i cant even get close without them aggroing my whole community. 3. Capture and force labor, with escape option. *not really important, may open a whole new can of worms. 4. Crafting system. (build carts, maybe include domestication of animals.)5. Clubs, rocks, hammer as defenseDefinitely worth what the developer is asking. The developer could be asking double and possibly attract more buyers with the illusion of value, however I respect to the developer as he's obviously not trying to gouge anyone. Also after looking at the replies from the developer, ive learned a lot about his attention to detail and his dedication to making a solid experience. He also replies to people in a mature way, which in relationship to previous points tells me he has good character and the kind of developer I want to support.

number of helpful: 9 of 10 people (90%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 19, 2016
VERDICT: For the most part I found Survivalist to be a very solid and enjoyable game.  On first appearances it may seem like a casual version of Dead State-lite but its not even turn-based. If you are a fan of State of Decay then you will be pleased to find a number of similarities with that game.Its a zombie survival RPG played in real-time with exploration, combat, character fatigue/hunger/ thirst, community recruitment, base building, tied together with some complex quests.  Unfortunately there are a few really frustrating things such as overly complex quest-arcs, somewhat frenetic combat and some very gamey aspects to recruiting and achievement hunting that bring it slightly down from being great.  Overall the game possesses some really well designed and implemented features which together add up to surpass the sum of its parts.  However it can be difficult to get into if you dont enjoy the feeling of not being in complete control.  If you are not great at multi-tasking or you dislike the pace and frantic nature of real-time combat then I would give this a miss or dont expect too much!  Those things almost put me off during my first aborted playthrough.  Yet if you can overlook them or possess a methodical approach to gameplay there's a very good game to discover.   One that surprised me but only if you have the patience and persistence to try.... More info below ...01. GENRE: Story-driven, zombie survival isometric RPG.  Played in real-time.02. SETTING: A post-apocalypic scenario full of rival communities in a fictional desert region around mid-west United States. 03. STORY/BACKGROUND: Take control of Joe Wheeler a successful hedge fund manager (i.e. tosser) who built his own bunker before the zombie apocalypse started.  After a year of surviving alone and with dwindling resources, its time to take your first steps into a harsh new world, recruit characters, form a community, build a base, gather resources and complete quests, while fighting bands of looters and avoiding infection from zombies.The story is fairly deep, with a complex main quest.  One that demands your full attention otherwise you can lose your bearings and get bored.  This is further complicated with the time sensitive nature of the insulin quest and your need to find more of it to keep a certain NPC alive.  Unfortunately there is also at least one convoluted quest where you have to wait, wait and wait for someone to die (if you dont want bad karma) to get an item you may desparately need [for more insulin].  These plain suck and take away from the satisfying quests.04. GAME MODES: A multiple story driven campaign played out on a single map with around two dozen quest arcs of varying length, complication and effort.  The main story arc has about 20 sub-quests to complete.  The core gameplay will take in excess of 50hours easily.  My playthrough took 90hours and it was far from comprehensive.  If you fail a quest you are given the chance to reload automatically.05. GAME/LEVEL DESIGN: The whole game takes place on one explorable map populated by survivor communities, zombies, deserted towns and looters.  The map is not fully open-world restricting exploration through the the nature of the insulin quest and the need to keep an eye on your community members.  The game can be continued after the main quest is finished.  If you are lucky you can attempt to complete the other two alternatives to the central quest.06. GAMEPLAY/MECHANICS: An almost perfect blend of features for the genre. Contains a good number of well conceived multi-option quests, well-rounded and flawed characters and a clever dialogue system even though sometimes gamey recruitment requirements for key characters - such as luring zombies near to them to increase respect. There is also excellent base building and community management, substantial item inventory, and a good RPG-lite stats for each character that determine key actions such as fitness, combat, construction, healing and farming.  Combat is frenetic in real-time which was hit and miss and, a fairly robust A.I. that allows you delegate tasks to community members even if it was not perfect.  Resource collection was a tad too slow, making the game last too long.07. ENEMIES: Zombies are unfortunately not the main threat in the game.  They exist alone or in small groups in unexplored areas.  They will try to run and bite your characters either alone or in groups until despatched.   Once the fog of war is exposed those areas are clear. Humans come in two forms: survivors and looters.  Combat doesnt necessarily need to occur with humans but once you start they will remain hostile until they are dead.  These attack with numerous weapons and in groups so are much more dangerous.  However periodically the groups of roving zombies and looters will target your base to keep you on your toes.08. A.I: The game possess some solid A.I.  It allows you to manage what tasks individuals are assigned, while having them seek; food, water and rest when they require it.  They will even hunt down ammo if they are low.  The A.I. was so well-made that the paltry issues I had were that farmers did not collect and store corn and if water wasnt available, they did not seek it from nearby wells.   Combat is straightforward enough, as they will shoot any perceived threat or attempt to kick them off if overwhelmed.09. CONTROLS: Fine but not completely initutive for a PC user.10. GRAPHICS: Basic.  Cartoony in nature but clear and good enough for the job.11. SOUNDTRACK & AUDIO: Unintrusive.  Firearms and reloading sounds are satisfying.12. VOICE ACTING: None.  But the well-written dialogue compenstates.13. CHALLENGE/DIFFICULTY: Easy to pick-up.  Not so easy to manage the party as it grows.  Its main difficult is determining the right course of actions to complete the quests in hand.  Combat also presents its challenges when faced with better equipped enemies. 14. PROBLEMS: No problems running the game experienced.  15. ACHIEVEMENTS: These are wide ranging.  Only a few are simple.  Some are overly complex.  If you are expecting easy and fast achievements this is not the game for you.  There are a couple that are insanely difficult to get and very time consuming!  On the other hand when you do trigger one its very satisfying.  Some of the achievements will need at least one replay.  Likely more. 16. DLC: None but a sequel is planned by the developer.  Yes I said developer.  It was made [mostly] by one person!  So kudos to him for a sterling effort!17. ONLINE PLAY/COMMUNITY: Did not try co-op but I would imagine if its stable the game would be twice as engrossing to play with two of you in the same group.18. ENJOYMENT/APPEAL: For a real-time RPG and indie game this really surprised me.  It has alot of great content even if only the main quest is replayable.  I think fans of games with the story and questing of Baldurs Gate and Icewind Dale, and the zombie survival and party/base management of State of Decay, Dead State wil definitely enjoy Survivalist.  Even if it appears to be the poor relation graphically.19. PLAYTIME/LONGEVITY/REPLAYABILITY: The game is built for at least one playthrough but given the complicated nature of the quest arcs and the all to real possibility of messing up something you could be playing this twice or three times as there are three possible player sanctioned goals that require the best part of the game to slowly achieve.  These are: Love, Money and Power.  Each has its own set of sub-quests you will really need to make and to some extent grinding goals to chip away at as you play.20. VALUE FOR MONEY: One of the few titles I would recommend at full price.  Getting it on a sale would just be a bonus.

content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												Hahahaha !  HAHA!! HAHAHAHAHA !!! HA !  HA !  HAHAAHA !!This game is -awesome- !I've only played about an hour so far, but even if it sucks from this point onward, it's still more than worth my five bucks.  It's great!  It's so unique and weird.  I love the little cinematic camera that traps everything going on around you in 3D, it's a little bit like watching a bad 80s zombie movie.This game oozes so much personality, I might just catch a social disease from it.Seriously, if you're even half thinking of it, buy the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.I've gotten enough fun out of the last hour that it doesn't matter where the game goes .. although I do have the impression that there's a bit of depth to it .. crafting, base building, long-term survival .. but I'm still muddling through early game.UPDATE (2 weeks later):Okay, so I've been playing a bunch of games - so many in the library, but Survivalist has been able to lure me pretty consistently.  So it isn't just a great first reaction, it's a great game overall.  Later on you get into politics and quests and drama with other survivors inside and outside your community, you get to grow your community, build a base, defenses, farm, etc.  I was surprised by how much depth the game has (as the graphics are a bit arcade-y).  There's a learning curve, but once you master the systems, you can assign all kinds of cool roles to your community members - farmer, scavenger, guard, etc ... and the AI is surprisingly good.8/10 overall

content:
Posted: June 2, 2016
												Survivalist is a surprising find. I don't know how to describe it to anyone that the other comments don't already do a good job of doing. You play as a survivor, you find other people along the way exploring, you do missions for other groups, build up your resources, including building your own town. It is beautiful in its simplicity and wonderful in a sandbox survival with a light hearted story. The fact is I wish there were more buildings, or atleast options to choose colors for your buildings. The game has a lot of amazing fun moments, and some over the top ridiculous story arcs, which made me laugh and I enjoyed the time I've played. If you want a game that will keep you surviving, wheeling and dealing, searching and constantly strategizing on how to get the upper hand, this game is a must play.

Posted: March 9, 2015
												I'll not spend too much time echoing what others have said.  Instead, I'll draw your attention to a key choice the game has you focus on:As you can see from the official trailer, Alice Ivers has type 1 diabetes and will die if she doesn't get her insulin.  Getting that insulin is something close to a full time job.  You have complete control over Alice and could easily march her off into the desert to die.  Or you grit your teeth, double down, and get one more syringe to get through one more day.It's honestly a tough call, and you don't find decisions like that in games these days.Good stuff.

												This is as the name of the game suggests its a game were you & a group of Survivalists most Survive in a post apocalyptic world one thing i can say is that for an indie game made by a very small indie dev team this game is amazing. the game has a nice look to it the game has a nice fiting soundtrack the game has great animations the game has a very nice torn-down beat up looking city you can loot , you can craft , you can build bigger & better defenses for houes you can fell the overall fell of the disaster that hit this games world & its after effects the gameplay is very smooth & nice & easy to control & there is a major plus to the contolrs you can play with keyboard & mouse or if you wish to do so you can even play it with an xb360 gamepad i have to say that i am very impressed with this game a indie game for 4.99 & its one of the better indie games here on steam i say that its a must buy if you are looking for an indie game that has a decent story great use of music & just overall a fun game to play then pick up this game. the only con i would give this game in a review is that the guns in the game they take a but of time to learn how to use them correctly at first i was shooting like a wild man & just missing my shots & waisting my bullets. but after i learned how to control my shots i never missed a shot. i give this game an 98 out of 100 i give it an 98 because of its an indie game made by a very very small dev team & what they made for there small team & extremely limted budget to make this game with i am very Pleasantly surprised with this game. you should all buy it & at least give it a shot. its only 4.99 usd & its very well worth the price.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												Okay, first off, this review is not a joke or anything, so this should help others who want to get this game or interested.Survivalist is a open-world RPG set one year after the zombie apacalypes. The game focuses on a business man named Joe Wheeler, who emerges from a underground bunker in the middle of a desert. Here are some Pros and Cons of the game.PROS:*Price tag for this game is relativaly cheap and affordable, about the same price of a 5 $ foot long at subway.*Big in-game map and lots of interesting locations.*The player can make decisions and choices.*Good amount of NPC's.*(SPOILER!!!!! BELOW!!!)Infected are harder than others and have different types of "strains"*A player can build a community.*A player can interact with a good number of NPC's*A player can learn skills*And much much more but I don't want to spoil anything :-) Like every game, it has its flaws...CONS:*Graphics aren't the best and may look outdated, however, if your interested in this game, this really shouldn't matter.*The Soundtrack........ terrible, just turn it off, unless you like retro during a zombie apocalypes, however, turning off the music sound isn't a challenge.*There aren't alot of weapon veriaty, the player only uses guns to defend himself or may use the characters fist, so don't expect UZI's or AK-47's, however, there are still some weopons but these are very broad with the name and description.*Combat: Combat is not the best in this game, as this game does not really focus on combat itself. Usually, you'll run into some looters or infected and shoot them and defend yourself. Don't expect anything special with the combat here in this game, as it focuses on survival. *This game is not for you if all your interested in is shooting zombies and getting killstreaks.CONCLUSION: Is this game worth it? Yes and of course, the game itself it a very unique take on survivaland living in a zombie apocalypes. However, like I mentioned above, if all you want is to kill zombies and get killstreak, this game is not for you. I have enjoyed playing this game alot so far and I never encountered a bug or glitch. For being a lesser known game developer, they really made a neat game. You should check it out yourself.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												Been ages since i played this game and I just noticed it's still being updated! This game merged several genera in really interesting and well executed ways. It's a zombie/survival game, a decent post-appocolypse rpg, and ... a city builder/management game? It's hard to quantify all the aspects of the game, the combat I disliked at first but then after the first couple hours I decided I really liked it. Involves a combination of click-to-aim, select-to-aim, and dodgeroll mechanics with light squad management aspects.The plot was a little (sometimes intentionally) cheezy but charming as well; there was one aspect of the plot that really created a sense of urgancy and commitment for me, but some of my friends didn't find it compelling so we had vastly differant experiences with that, (which is a good thing!).The building and management aspects turned out to be really awesome as well and were my favorite part of the game.  For five dollars this game was a real steal for that alone.If you like Walking Dead, City builders, and zombie games this game is easily worth your time (since for 5$ money isn't the issue) and it is a solid buy.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2015
												Okay, so I have played about 38 hours worth of this game now.In short, I like it, and it's dirt cheap!You start out with the main protagonist, a hedge fund manager, with no great skill, no weapons, a few packets of chips, some water and some bandages. You leave the bunker, only to be attacked while looking for your car. You beat up the zombie, take his gun and ammo, and from then on, get ready to shoot some Zombies.But the main focus of this game really isn't on the Zombie shooting. You need to find other survivors, entice them to join you through various methods, and slowly build a community. You can build buildings, fortifications, farm food, draw water from the well you dug, and most importantly, trade and scavenge for food and other supplies.The game becomes increasingly harder, giving thougher Zombies and looters to fight while you solve various quests and increase your numbers.By now I have plenty food, water, ammo and a completely build camp with walls and towers, and most importantly about 10 inhabitants.And still, I haven't seen the entire map yet, or found all the challenges to come. Great game, especially when you consider the price!

content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												This is the Zombie game I've been waiting for since the genre exploded. It is a superbly well thought out game and contains a perfect mix of RPG, Base building and Adventure.RPG: Characters level up. They improve as they carry out the actions in several different areas. You can also purchase books which improve their skill whilst in the inventory. Your actions are remembered by NPCs too and their opinion of you is fluid throughout the game based upon your actions.Base Building: This is just sublime. Yes, the buildings are generic templates, but you can buid those fences, fortifcations and such however and wherever you like. One very minor point is that it's fairly tricky to build anywhere other than the default place, but as mentioned before, what you do to enhance it and how, that's very much up to you.Adventure: There are storylines! You have to curry favour with various individuals and factions. This can open up other questlines, and you can even persuade them to join your cause. I believe prices charged by vendors for items can be swayed this way too.This truly is a magnificent game. Until this game came along, State of Decay was probably the closest to 'realism' and sense of survival against the odds with dwindling supplies. This, for me, while it doesn't perhaps look quite as gorgeous to look at, is infintely better it almost all other aspects of the game.Since buying it I've hardly gotten any housework done, and I've contemplating phoning in sick at work!The developer seems to be a one man team - and he is very active on forums, answering questions and discussing feedback. Can't wait for Survivalist 2 (PLEASE MAKE IT HAPPEN!)Thoroughly recommended.

number of helpful: 21 of 35 people (60%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												A HIDDEN GEM. I was very surprised by this game. Survivalist is a top down post-apocalyptic RPG similar to State of Decay and Dead State. Set one year into the zombie apocalypse you start off as a wealthy business man with heaps of worthless money who has been living alone in a bunker for a whole year hoping to wait out the apocalypse, but then your bunker supplies unexpectedly ran out. Left with no choice but to venture outside you will encounter other survivors, zombies, looters and so your adventure begins in this zombified desert wasteland.The game is not perfect but it is still very fun to play. The graphics are pretty dated; they look like The Sims 2 from 2004 level of graphics but with better shadow effects. But this is probably due to the game be ported over from old Xbox 360 hardware, which also limits the frame rate to about 30 so that may turn some people off. Also the aiming is off as you cannot pull off any headshots against your enemies which makes gun combat pretty annoying in early game where your character's firearms skills are low and can lead to some pretty cheap deaths with your characters. Also ammo and supplies are plentiful in this game which can take away some of the hardcore survival aspects of this game.But the positives out-way the negatives, gameplay is still fun and there is a lot to see and do, there is a good package here for just $5. If you enjoy zombie games like State of Decay which is also similar, then you will have no serious problems with this game.Survivalist has my seal of approval.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												I Have spent a few good hours on this game and felt it worthy of writing a rewiew. I have enjoyed this title so far, Even thought I feel like the controls are made for a controller more than a keyboard every thing is still responds smoothly. There are a lot of interactions with NPC in this game, some of the dialog is very funny, and what you choose to say can affect the story. I have found this game to be one of those that you better save often or youll find yourself loosing a few hours of game play because you saved three hours before you got infected, or injured. I like the NPC team control in this game. You must keep track of your survivors health and sleep statistics, or at least make sure they have food and water available to eat and drink themselves. You can send survivors in different directions and on different quest at the same time. There is a system that allows you to give orders and the survivors will use their own AI to complete the task given. So far I have one fetching water, one fetching wood, and the other is completeing the story quest. Ammo is sometimes hard to come by in this game and youll need a lot of it to level your firearm skills. Dont allow the infected to bite you as the antigen is hard to come by and is very expensive. I think this game has a neat User Interface it is simple I really enjoy the action camera view in the UI. So far what ive explored of the map is pretty fun, not knowing whats ahead always makes things tense however I feel that the survivors would be able to see a bit further than they are able to in the game, but then they wouldn't have so many suprise infected moments.     For those who are looking for a fun single player game with a good setting,story, and action then I can easily reccommend this game. If you are wanting a sandbox, openworld, build it yourself then I reccommend 7 Days to Die because this is a different type of game. I have had no issues with performance on this game either everything worked very smooth from the beginning. I am using Windows 7 x64 and Radion HD 5450 series video card. Overall I could easily give this game a 9/10 score. The only reason it didn't get 10 is every good game can use more content, or even a coop player mode right?

content:
Posted: March 9, 2015
												As a new comer to indie games, I was slightly skepticle about spending the $5 for it.  Thankfully there is a demo available for it, and after I played the demo, I was sold.  Best way to describe Sruvivalist would be a "post apocalyptic, zombie survival, base building, resource gathering goodness".  While the graphics may not be "top of the line", and the camera cannot zoom in or out(same with minimap), and at the moment; there really are only three guns available(been unable to locate the sniper rifle if it is in game yet; found plenty of ammo but no gun,  the gameplay itself is very solid.  The music is well made, and the idea of being able to improve relations with various survivor groups around you to possiably recruit them later is very nice.  On top of the basic find food, water, guns and ammo, the devs also included a twist of one of the survivors you find that joins up with you, needs insuline b/c they are type-1 diabetic; resulting in some nail biting moments when running to the nearest trader in hopes they have some left for sale to save her life.  Melee is fun, but much more enjoyable when using a fire arm.  Filling a zombie with lead and then kicking them away is entertaining as well as if the slo-mo kills get combined into it.  One of my personal favorite things they did for this game is to allow you to build your own base (once you find a survivor that can help build, but they are near by in the beginning ;) ).  Base building can seem pretty straight forward, build a wall here, gate there, tower over here, shack over there.  However, to build the base, you need supplies, aka lumber, chicken wire, cement, ect ect ect.  This causes you to either just let one person build, than go out alone to gather supplies(which will only be one of each since the mats weigh so much), or send out a few ppl to gather the mats, so the builder can stay safely tucked away in the base and they can protect each other?  Mean while, you can keep exploring and looting.  Also enjoy the fact that you can start growing your own food and make a well, creating a self sufficent base.Sometimes while exploring you will find small camps of looters, that want nothing more than what you have, and they will attack.  A nice feature is sometimes, one of them will surrender, and offer to join you if you wish, leaving you the choice to take them in, take all of their stuff, or kill them.  Many npcs will have quests, and there are a few times where "things are not as they seem" with the quest, adding to the depth of the game.  There are so many positive things that can be said about this game they greatly reduce or destroy any negativity I may have about it.  It is after all, a indie game.  For $5, you get more out of it than many $20 + games made by reconized labels.  I'd have no qualms about spending $10 for this game. I'd highly recommend this game to any one, and if you are unsure, check out the demo first.

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 9, 2016
												A fantastic game. I was slow to playing and finishing it, I never had much time to play games these days.I finally got around to it now, 50 hours in 2 weeks or so, and I feel positive about the ending that I followed.-The game allows you to build a new thriving society however and where ever you want in the game world, but you're limited to the supplies you have and can find.-Zombies. It is a zombie survival game but it's not boring. It has an interesting and depressing story behind it where there are no right answers.-Karma. A Karma like system exist in which NPCs will either like you or hate you to a certain degree. Some will like you so much that the price of items go down while those who hate you will leave your community or outright attack you.-Scavenge. It wouldn't be a survival game without some scavenging involved. Set up supply routes with your survivors to keep your flow of wood, wire, and cement going strong. Be wary of Looter Gangs and Infected Hordes that emerge from the small towns.-Control or command. Control each survivor in your community individually or command them as a group as you would an RTS. Issue orders such as Guard, Farm, or Supply run to keep them busy. Don't worry about their needs. If they need food, water or sleep, they can do so themselves and return to their assigned duties. I found it useful to have a larger community with good fighters to cover the Watch Towers. So say 10 Watch Towers, with 20 Guards on shifts. One guard goes to sleep the others take their place. Giving the community 24/7 protection from anyone or anything sneaking in, and the buggers do manage to sneak in if you're not careful.-Story. There is a story involved and it's good. You meet your main character Joe Wheeler, likely of Captain Planet fame which explains why he's so despicable. He survived in a Bunker for a year but now needs to venture out. He meets a damsel in distress. Ok cool, what does she need? Oh that's easy. Kill her sister... well she's infected so good news. Bad news is telling her she's infected. I am joking. Now Alice Ivers plays as your secondary main. Her Chat options are much kinder than Wheelers and will achieve more friendships than Wheeler will who is better off as an imposing figure to intimidate people to his will. Finally we meet the third character who players only use to build the base. Isham Seely, the sole survivor of his community who joins up to assist in helping Alice with her problem. She needs Insulin and there isn't a lot to go around.So now with Wheeler as a fighter, Alice as a healer, and Isham as a builder, you're off to a great start to playing this game the best to your ability to swindle, convince, fight, and manipulate others, or, are you being manipulated yourself by those you trust the most? Honestly, I trust the Antagonists of this game more than I do any one else. At least they're honest about what they do.After 85 hours now, I feel accomplished. What an experience and for a very low price. This is a survival game that doesn't get boring so easily. The map isn't too big, there are over 400+ characters with their own stories and needs, and you can choose to help them or kill them outright. You can build your home where you need it to be or build multiple homes. Burn homes down, take over territories, whatever. It was a blast and I cannot recommend it anymore than I can right now.I never knew this game was going to be so damn good.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												Erm why do my hours dont add up? anywho its a good zombie survival game with a decent story line and well highly recommended for the price range. It doesn't need a powerful computer to run and I think your grandpa's pc will be sufficient as well.You start solo and then can expand into a community which enables you to control any character in your group. Yes, you do need to gather food supplies, ammo, water and well medical supplies like any other zombie survival game by either scavenging or trading with other npcs. What I like most about this game is the challenge it might provide as well as the little details the developer managed to fit in such a light game. One of the initial, rather a major character suffers from diabetes so you need to find some specific medicines for her from time to time. As you over use a character, it becomes tired and end up being less productive so you are forced to shuffle which is a POSITIVE here. You can kill any character and decide if you want to complete a mission or not. It has base building which is pretty straight forward and unlike other games, it takes real man hours to complete construction (an NPC fetches resources and builds).I could go in detail (not really) but lets keep it short. Using steam rating logic I rate this game 11 out of 10.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												Good concept, clunky execution.  The camera angles, combat, looting, controls and character interaction (basically the whole game) are all really clunky and not enjoyable.  I was hoping this was going to be a great game, it is full of great ideas but as a whole it is very poorly designed and put together.One of my biggest issues is the "fog of war" that covers everything and is only revealed when you get REALLY close to it.  As in I'm sure even someone with poor vision could at least see the outline of a building 20 feet away, but it's blacked out for no good reason until I get close enough to spit on it.  Combat is often initiated because you can't see things coming due to the "FOW" and the zeds get on top of you so fast you can't do much about it.  The combat controls are crappy at best, however I do like that you can initiate a kick while holding a pistol or other weapon.  Lots of games would make you put the weapon away to kick or punch.   The building aspect is a good idea but I haven't bothered trying to drag around enough stuff to build anything so I'm not sure if it's useful or more trouble than it's worth, however that is something more zombie survival genre games need so I give the game a solid +1 for adding that.I guess if you love the genre pick this up on sale, otherwise steer clear.  Despite not really liking the game I'll probably still play it a bit here and there since I see potential there.  Just wish I'd paid even less than I did.  Got my fingers crossed that this game gets straightened out soon.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												This is quite literally one of the BEST indie games i have EVER played. It made it into my top 5 and it should be in yours if its not already. This game has so much content i was baffled that it only cost 5 dollars. The game lets you choose your own goals which effect the storyline, theres fantastic combat, zombies dont respawn which some might consider a negative but i actually like that since you can effectively set up safe zones where theres no threat of attack, but even then if you enter a major township a pack of zombies or lotters might pick up your scent and follow you back to your base. The looting is amazing, i was always excited to see what new buildings held and what i was gunna bring home with me. The character interaction is top notch, you can switch to any player in your community at any time and control them as you would the main character, and so the character you currently control will have different views of different people and people outside your community will see that character differently than your main character, which makes character selection when interacting with other communities very important. Lastly, the build up to the final fight and the final fight itself with los ceros is amazing. I was losing it trying to make sure that everyone in my community was geared up for a good fight, and we certaintly had a good fight which was quite satisfying. I'll say it now, I WANT ANOTHER!!!! Gimme a damn sequel and i'll play the hell out of it. I LOVE THIS GAME! I will support it to the ends of the earth and you should to! This game is just 5 bucks and youll get countless hours of fun out of it so what the hell are you waiting for? GET IT!!!!

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
												A very well made game. The graphic and layout may gives an impression of a cheap and sub par game but when you try it, you know you were wrong. Well, after you finished the tutorial of course. The first few hours of the game might be boring but if you stick to it until you get your base, that's the real fun and action really starts.Pro: - Nice story. It is not a blockbuster, but it is not as simple as save-the-damsel-in-distress-but-she-is-in-another-castle linear type of story.- Nice implementation of RPG gameplay. You start weak, you end strong. You start poor, you end rich. You start with fist, you end with a rocket launcher. You start alive, you end dead, at least couple of time for me near the end.- Nice action/combat. It's kinda simplistic, but fits well with the gameplay. Some people dislike the targeting system where with the lowest skill, you can even miss at melee distance. For me it is done well as you can improves it with firearm skill. It's better than not being able to use certain weapon due to not meeting the requirement. You want to use a rifle? You can, but you'll waste lots of rifle bullets. If the rifle bullets are too precious, keep using the gun until you get better with your aiming.- Nice enemy. Some people dislike the infected being able to detect you from distance and ambush you. I think that's brilliant. It will give you a sense of fear and always be careful when exploring especially new area. It's not zombicalypse if you're not fear for your life. You're not only dealing with zombie, but also with human. - Adequate partial RTS. You can build a base, or multiple bases. You can provide shelter and create a self sustain community. Fend off gang of raiders or zombies. I would love to have more choice, but it is adequate for the game.- It's a survival. You need to eat, you need to drink, you need to sleep, you need to make lov...maybe not. Be prepare for your adventure and scavenge as needed.- Choices you make, affect the game. All those people you kill, all those people you shakedown, all those presents you give, will affect others.- There are no "I'm the kindest, purest, friendliest, generous" type of gameplay. It's a state of emergency, act like one.- Large map. It is kinda empty, but it is large.Cons:- Slow tutorial. The tutorial is embedded within the storyline. It'll be a while before you'll complete the tutorial and left only with a real quest. Before the tutorial completed, the game kinda boring, which turn off some of the players.- Some part of the objective give you a sense of rushing towards the ends. You don't have all the time in the world to explore the map (in the beginning). It's part of the story, and with a good reason to do so, but some people just get annoyed by it. Me included. After finishing the game, I'm glad it's there. It serves a purpose. A valid purpose.- Super equipment to know everything. I'm not sure why it's there, but it feels like a cheat.- After you established a self sustain base, the survival part of the game feels empty. Corns are way too effective that it's becoming a trading commodity.

content:
Posted: April 11, 2016
												I like the game, it`s pretty deep with a "nice" story that keeps you going. There`s a lot of stuff to do and a BIG map to explore (with FoW). Farming, quests, building and more... For only $3 it`s a steal and worth it for sure :-)One thing I keep doing is trying to tilt the camera down from a top down view but no such luck...Works like a charm with my DS4 controller and the menus are nice and tidy.I wish I could set the autosave to a shorter timeframe (I always forget to save, and I die a lot).- I only got a few hours (so far) but this is a game you could spend A LOT of time in, and as I said for only $3 it`s a lot of bang for your buck!+ Nice setting (I like the apocalypse theme).+ Great skill leveling system.+ Farming.+ Base building.+ PvE (you have to manage thirst, food, sleep etc.).+ Detailed quests.- "Easy mode" (I`m a wimp).- "Zombies" are crazy fast (not just a bad thing, but it scares the crap out of me).- Lack of autosave option.Do I recommend this game? YES!!!

Looters will find your people, or you will find their camps, and then they'll rob you, and it's not a case of "SHOOT 'EM, BE A HERO". Do that only if you enjoy shotguns and snipers to the chest.But I've raved about nothing. :p Just look around; The game isn't to everyone's taste.

content:
Posted: August 13, 2016
Product received for free
												Survivalist is an open world RPG best played with friends, to enjoy the Zombie apocalypse together in a cozy bunker and provide to your little community. Without other players it is possible to give tasks to the different characters that can be recruited, and I was surprised to see that the AI did a good job managing them.The different systems for survival are logical and work well, without being too hardcore to be a hassle. Survival is definitely not a constant chore as in Don't Starve. Killing a Zombie is easy... Except when there starts to be more of them. Shooting is not too fast, it's not a shoot'em'up, but it still works well enough to balance fun and tension, especially when it becomes possible to aim specific body parts.Just don't expect too deep. Not much is said about each characters, they just all have enough to be different,  Overall it's a light take on The Walking Dead, free for you to express your own story.The graphics seem a bit poor at first, but once again this is very functional as the zoomed-in/portrait camera allows to give more personality than a top-down view would do alone, and ends up being quite endearing.To conclude, Survivalist managed to be enjoyable to me despite not liking survivals and RPGs. I found that it is because all its systems are very functional. Everything is well done, a perfect balance between easy and difficult. Enough complexity without being unforgiving and annoying.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 7, 2015
												My name is Joe Wheeler, its been 364 days since the end of the world, im out of food and water, tomorrow i will venture onto the surface in search of more.So i walked down the road in search of my car, its still there, parked where i left it, but it doesnt work anymore, and not only that but there was a corpse lying beside it. When i ventured closer to the corpse it stood up, so i proceeded to ruin my suit and bash the corpses head in with my bare hands.The corpse had within its pockets a loaded gun and a large amount of extra ammunition for it. I needed to find a town, and people. My radio let me know of an sos call nearby that i might check out. Probably not, i dont like getting involved with other peoples♥♥♥♥♥♥ On my way down the road i found another corpse, it stood up yet again, but i was expecting this and i had my new found pistol ready, it took me a few shots, roughly about a clip before i got lucky and put a bullet between the blazing green eyes.It was quicker and easier than the first corpse, but i still missed alot so i decided to train a bit on a nearby parking sign. I got a few good shots in and decided to continue into the nearby town because that was still the reason i was out here right now.So i found some food, and decided i would in fact check out that sos call. Who knows, maybe they have some food or something i can have?I met a girl and killed her sisters corpse, this one had red eyes, i wonder if that means anything, i think it does, all of my shots landed thanks to my training on the sign, but it still took almost 4 entire clips to put her down. The girls started following me around now, apparently she was headed for a different town before she and her sister were attacked by other living corpses.We ran into another man, he gave us some insulin (the girl turns out to be diabetic, who knew) and offered to help us hold up somewhere, he tells us he knows a thing or two about building, and he'll even gather the supplies himself.Well not long after, i was just out looking for food and now im lying here bitten and bleeding out quickly. I'm not going any further than this. So i guess this is the end for Joe Wheeler huh? Oh well, lifes a ♥♥♥♥♥ and then you die heh...These were my first about 20 minutes of survivalist, and i have to say its an excellent game, despite its age and cheap price, its excellent and has a very deep gameplay. By this i mean, its not a tps or an fps, or anything of the sorts. Its a very in depth survival game where food, water, sleep and even insulin are all required to live. It has a good learning curve, as long as your not an idiot like me, where your fairly babied here and there, your first two enemies can barely move, and even if they catch you, just tap space and your fine, but your third enemy, is a sprinting zombie who jumps out of nowhere and tackles you, and moves too quickly to aim your gun at properly, but get tackled 4-5 times without getting a shot in and the game says "hey, moron, SIDESTEP" which in turn, dodges the attack and gives you time to aim your gun. This game is really cool and one awesome thing is in the top right corner theres a little window which shows events as they happen, if you swing a punch, you get a full body view of your character swinging said punch, if your talking to someone, the camera alternates between each persons faces. But the game isnt without fault, a strange and unchangable camera angle forces a omewhat top down view which i enjoy, however you cant change it, and id like even a SMALL amount of ability to change it apart from simple 360 degree rotations. And theres also the fact that while tutorial missions do baby you a tad, when theyre done, thats it, zombies come in different levels, green being the lowest, then blue, red and apparently theres a "White super zombie race" each gets progressively stronger and all the tutorial missions are against green and thats it, with a single red but theyre somewhre u can hit them but they cant hit you so that doesnt matter, but i accidentally wandered the wrong way and got instantaneusly mauled to death by a hord of about 15 blues.But this game is still amazing, and cheap as dirt, i would have happily payed triple what i did for it just to support the developers. 10/10

Posted: June 17, 2015
												I was expecting buggy 90's gaming throwbacks based on the screenshots. And it's a yet another wombie-game...But the positive reviews and the low price during the Summer Sale convinced me to pick it up and give it a whirl. I've been whirling since. I have been playing several hours and still can't decide whether I should continue exploring or expanding my base. Or moving my base elsewhere? I wouldn't know. I'm too wrapped up in this game and its surprisingly suspenseful gameplay. This is more of a RPG than an action game, but you can't win on auto-pilot: you need a strategy and some decent reflexes. Or the firepower to make up for it. I can't even create a coherent review now that I'm not playing. I'm thinking of strategies to build and strengthen my community without invoking war...The map has its limits but it looks pretty big and the side-quests seem endless, so this game will probably have me hooked for a good 100 hours or so. By far the best game I've picked up this Summer Sale.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												This game has complete inovative and never heard before story.. Not... Hehe, but even though it's about zombies which has been chewed to the death it bring something that should count the most in games world, playability! And this game has it in abundance! I'll try to review it without spoilers :)It's about John Wheeler, some broker dude who did some fine investments in his life that made possible for him to buy a shelter in the desert.. All hell broke loose, he hid there for one year until his supplies run out and decided to get out of bunker..That's where you start leading this dude through his adventure. Game is incredible because only one dude made it! And he managed to implement many great aspects like character development, relationships with npc's, trading and even some RTS and building elements!Like I said, you are John Wheeler, no nonsense dude, who wants to survive zombie outbreak, and (depends of the player decision), achieve his life goal of love/money/power. It has sort of isometric view, game is very fluid, it offers few standard weapons and enemies, and besides outer danger, you have to take care of sleep, hunger and thirst.. So, especially in the beginning, save water and food cans :)As you progress through the game, it gives you option to make a settlement, recruit people to join your cause, plant corn, build wells etc.. Interesting part is that you can control everyone who is in your settlement/group, so when Wheeler needs to sleep, you just play with other characters..Almost everyone is "expendable", except Wheeler, which gives you much freedom.. Ofc., you can save game anytime, so if you are opsessive like me, you can always do missions without casualties :)..Ofcource, people can leave your camp, based on your actions and their approval of those actions. Some people will approve your violent nature, some won't etc.. Be careful when you recruit people, because if you recruit people from opposing camps, they will attack if they run across eachother regardless of their current "group". PRO- very interesting main story with many intriguing side missions like saving people from zombies, other people, burning stuff, building stuff, finding missing persons, their stuff..- great playability and replayability!,- easy to use/comprehend inventory and trading systems,- very good balance between story and action,- 4 player coop online, one player can scavange, one build settlement, one just killing and grinding characters, one doing missions!,- almost everything :)CONS (remember, this game has CONS only if you compare it with some blockbuster games, but remember, one dude made this game, so taken this into account, every CON here is irrelevant)- it could use some more items for food or drink, it only has corn and dog food.. And only water for drinking (and wine, but wine is used for increasing relationship status with NPS's)- shortness hahahaha, well, game isn't short, it is actually pretty long, but after you finish it, it gives you that feeling "I WANT MORE" hehheThis game is a must have, if you want hours of fun and exploaration, action, story telling, if you want to see how world gets on based on your decision (directly and indirectly), i.e. I once expelled one dude from my settlement, gave him gun, few bullets and let him go.. About few hours later, while scavanging, that same dude, now zombified killed two dudes from my group XD. Your actions have very lasting consequences..Big shout to Bob the P.R Bot, the dude who made this great game (something tells me that it's not his real name :/..p.s. It also offers 4 coop online which is incredible to play! Accidently ReviewedWas this review helpful or maybe even not helpful? Either way join this group for more. Free Keys and Reviews weekly!
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Accidently

number of helpful: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 9, 2015
Blog Review: http://wildwoodgeek2.blogspot.com/2015/05/pc-game-review-survivalist.htmlWhat Survivalist did RightNice building systema cool feature in Survivalist is the building. you can build fences and razor wire to protect your chosen home base, protecting you from zombie hordes and raiders. you build houses for your followers and fellow survivors. you can build bunkers to give you an edge when fighting gun wielding hostiles. by the late game you'll have a nice little town. Large open world to exploresomething that Survivalist did right is its large open world for you to explore. you can also set up your base anywhere you want Hostile Factions Attack eventsthe cities are the best places to find loot and food but going into them often will cause your base to be attacked by looters or zombie hordes. this adds some nice challenge to the game, it makes it dangerous to visit the cities a lot.What Survivalist did Wrong No real choices in dialogue several times during the game you will be able to make dialogue “choices”. the only problem is that they really aren't choices.  you will get three ways to be a jerk without the choice to be  nice or understanding. or you will get three ways to be nice and understanding without a choice to be a jerk. Zombies are way too fastZombies in Survivalist run as fast, if not faster than a speeding car. im not  joking. when you see a zombie it will be on top of you in 1 to 2 seconds. Worst shooting system in a game evershooting in Survivalist is horrible. really horrible. if shooting worked this way in real life armies would be still be using swords. when you aim at a zombie or hostile NPC you have to wait about 5 to 10 seconds to even have a chance of hitting them. and if you or they move your “aiming” resets completely. and with the zombies being so fast it makes it impossible to wait to aim. also hostile NPCs seem to have pin-point accuracy hitting you virtually every shot. Way too fast Day/Night systemSurvivalist has a Day/Night system. during night your view is even more limited and more zombies are racing about. the problem is that the day is about six minutes. you and all your friends are weaklingsthis makes sense for you. i mean you’re a hedge fund manager. but why is every friendly person a weak shell of a human being? by that i mean that they will run out of stamina after just a few seconds of running. or they can only hold a few things of food before running out of storage space. Annoyingly unhelpful Tutorial In Survivalist they have kind of “learn as you go” tutorial. you play in the game world while they teach you want to do. the problem is it doesn't work. as i was leaving my bunker for the first mission i got hurt and needed to heal. but because they had to tell me how to open my inventory i couldn't. they didn't give me the pop-up message on how to open inventory until i got to a certain place. the problem with that is that there are two very strong zombies  in the way between me and that place, and with my person slowed even more by the wound i already had i could barely get past them.  Bad inventory systemanother annoying thing in Survivalist is the fact that you can’t not drop things. you can only destroy them. also you can not select how much you want to destroy, you can only destroy the whole stack. this was really annoying to me as during my play through i had too much stuff and had already gotten ridden of all the junk out of my pack. i had a 50X stack of gold and if i dropped 10 i would be good. but i couldn't so i had to lose my 50 pieces of gold. Bad graphicsI know I know, graphics aren't everything. but Survivalist looks worse than a PS2 game. everything is jagged and blurry.Final ThoughtsSurvivalist is by no means the best RPG zombie game out there, but it isn't the worst. if you really like RPGs and/or zombie games you should try Survivalist. and if you hate it you've only lost 5 bucks.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2015
												As with all open world games, it starts off pretty slowly, leading you through the tutorial with minimal effort. After that, the game seems to slow down. It doesn't of course, but while you've got your main guy out exploring, shooting zombies, etc, the girl you pick up sleeps for about two days (and so you can't do anything with her), and the construction guy (no, not Emmett) walks at a snail's pace between your camp and the local hardware store, bringing back a single plank at a time so he can start building walls, shacks, even toilets.That said, this is about the only complaint I have about the game. The rest of it is simple (gameplay, not difficulty), intuitive, and fun. Just... While you're exploring, don't forget to save regularly. It's pretty easy to wander out of your 'safe' zones, and if that happens, you're going to be the one seeking breakfast brains.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
												This game is worth more than the $5 the developers ask for. The gameplay is amazing and overcompensates for the graphics which aren't too shabby in all honesty. The game has a lot of potential and is a must for RPG fans. You can choose how to interact with all of the world, whether you want to put a bullet in every living thing or be a complete pacifist you can do whatever you want, whenever you want. The only real problem is that the main quest makes the game somewhat linear and can get annoying at some points. The whole "get insulin for a useless npc" gets tiring after a while and I would hope they remove that completely. However irritating Alice is, the game is still an amazing title.

												This game is pretty fun and intuitive as to how it works.  I didn't have any trouble mastering the controls within half an hour. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 20, 2015
												I'm blown away by how fun and challenging this game is, even the story is good which you don't really find in these type of games. I can't believe it was only $5 it's worth at least $20.I restarted after I decided to let a certain person die and now I play at my own pace, building up my stronghold, exploring the map, recruiting people, finding out the big picture as well as the little side quests that add a lot of story and interesting details.It has RPG elements in that you and other survivors that may join you have skills. Some will be good at shooting or medical, others are good at building or farming. All these skills will level up, slowly, as you use them.It also has the survival/building element. You have to secure your base, wherever you decide that may be. You scavenge for wood, wire, cement and then build them into walls homes and defensive structures. There is no mining or woodcutting so there is a limited amount of materials so you must plan well.The pacing is really good. the zombies close to the starting area are easy, but at the beginning you have few weapons and low skill so they are a challenge as well. As you progress and go out into the map further the zombies are tougher so it scales well to your abilites and weapons. It helps to bring along a friend.The only setback that may turn some people off is the perspective. It initially seems like the view area is too small but this is done so that you can't see the zombies and other threats from a mile away. It may seem annoying when you 1st start the game but you will quickly get used to it. It gets much better with a sniper rifle.I have sunk a lot of hours into it already and I feel like I'm only about half way. There are tons of areas of the map to explore still and a lot of quests left. This is one of those "I can't stop playing" games!Edit: updating for Steam nomination. This is a great game!

content:
Posted: May 7, 2015
												It catched me in just 3 hours. This review can change in the next days I keep playing, but at the moment I can say it's a deep game.About the PROS: If you like background stories, there's a lot of microstories as you do  your main quests. As in any other sandbox worth his salt, you can chose to do your quests or just roam for loot and improve your base. I'm not used at all to play multi-character RPGs so I can say this game makes it easy to control different characters, doing different actions in different parts of the map. That's so enjoyable because you can just ask your stronger man to go and search for heavy supplies for your base while your gardener keeps farming and your firegunner roam killing bandits or doing missions. And you can chose who you control, or you just can take care of them all. The AI is pretty good despite some path errors, the zombies are hard enough to beat in numbers and easy enough to kill one by one. The freedom to chose your playstyle as bandit, hero, neutral, or whatever is great -a guy wanted me to pay him 75 coins for a cure of the infection, I bribed him with an item 10-15 coins worth, he now wanted me to pay him "just" 73 coins for the cure. I killed him, got a lot of coins and the cure-.About the CONS: I feel there's so little variety of weapons. It doesn's seem like more will be added since every weapon has already a hotkey number 1-9. This is not really a negative aspect, but sometimes is hard to end missions cause the guys who give them to you go and fight and sometimes die, so you have to chose between loading the game or keep going without the mission. Too many ammo. Sometimes you forget it's an apocalypse because since the beggining of the game the mainstory leads you to a weapon storage with 12000 (yes, you did read well) pistol bullets and like 500 shotgun shells and rifle ammo. Anyways you can buy bullets SO cheap. Its true that in the beggining you're not very acurate, and zombies needs more than 1 bullet most of the times, but I like to worry about my ammo when it's about the end of the world, and here you will just shoot like a rambo. I will edit the review while i keep playing, thx for reading!

content:
Posted: May 4, 2016
												Most likely the best value I've gotten for 4,99€ EVER. It contains so much content and gameplay. The RPG system with decisions and reputation works very well (your choices to matter), action is simple and easy to understand, yet extremely entertaining. Society growth and base building is really fun and the storyline is interesting. Food and supplies are scarce and requires effort to gather which makes the survival aspect of the game feel real. Since online co-op mode is on the rise aswell, this game is looking to become one of the better survivalist projects out there in my opinion.The only negative thing I can mention about this game is the fact that there are some abusable bugs out there, such as bugs which allows you to gather more supplies than intended. Other than that, I can't really find anything negative.I really recommend this game to anyone out there who's looking for an interesting indie, society building, survival RPG-game.

												For a game made by one person. Its a gem. And at its 5 dollar price, even more so.The graphics may not be the best, and the AI may need some micromanaging at times, but those aside its an amazing game.The combat feels like an arcade shooter (Which I mean in a good way) and the base building is both solid and enjoyable. Could use some polishing and personal variety with the characters, but otherwise very solid.With that said, its hard to find a game that offers what this game does for the price it is. Go get it.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
												I admit, originally when i saw this game i thought 'This is a nice concept though it doesn't seem very well executed, also looks kind of strange'. I bought the game thinking 'Might as well give it a try'. I played the game on the edge of my chair trying to keep my survivors alive for just another day. I still haven't stopped playing this game(I'm actually trying to complete a quest as i type this).Overall, this game is a fresh & interesting combination between a classic topdown zombie survival game, Sims & The Walking Dead. Pros:Not purely quest-driven. I've played more than my fair share of zombie games that are 'Go get X object, return the object to Y person, get Z reward and progress in the game'. Survivalist does away with the linear quest-driven system & replaces it with a nice 'Go do it if you want to, or if you don't just don't. We're not going to hold anything away from you if you don't'.If you're told 'Go and stop this gang' then you also have the choice of assimilating into your group/community instead of just marching in there & murdering everyoneA unique relationship system. Instead of the standard 'i like you, i don't' Survivalist has a twin-axis system of respect and approval. You can make someone do what you want by either making them like you, or fear you. They see you burn their village to the ground single-handedly then they'll fear you, if you save them from being bitten they'll like you.Well-balanced progressive gamplay that keeps you from becoming too powerful, whilst hard work/dedication/planning pay off greatlyCons:40 hours in and I'm yet to find something bad about the game that wasn't caused by oversight or just plain stupidity on my part

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
												Survivalist is an open world, survival RPG where you play as Joe Wheeler, a self-centered businessman who has built a bunker just before the apocalypse with resources sufficient for one year, lived in his bunker during the apocalypse without any connection with the outer world, and finally decided to go out into the wasteland when he got out of resources. He doesn't have the slightest idea about the events happened after the apocalypse, unfamiliar with the surroundings, people and of course zombies.Skip to the end for TL;DRI will start with pointing the best thing about this game: the atmosphere. The feeling of isolation, chaos and depression, which are the outcomes of apocalypse are perfectly reflected. There will be times when you will have tough chocies, times you have to decide between two parties and you can't simply pick the 'evil' out of the sides, as moral values/ethics are simply not valid anymore; in a world where looting is the only way to survive, killing a person is justified by a simple conflict of interest and overall, being strong is the ultimate goal of everyone. As humanity has taken a step back from the civilization, there are no laws and no enforcers. People have done what they had to do, in order to increase their chances to survive, they have gathered and started forming groups. There are small civilized settlements which started raising their own crops, outlanders, bandits, looters and all sorts of groups in game.  Now with such a case, a logical human being would find a decent community that shares his/her interests and join them. But Joe Wheeler happens to have a better idea; without knowing absolutely no one in this world and having nothing to offer, he will start building his own settlement. This is the goal of this game. To make Joe Wheeler lead the biggest/strongest settlement in the area (i.e. feed his ego). Other than the first two characters who join you within the progress of storyline, people are not willing to leave their current, steady systems and join your newly-founded formation. And neither they are going to do it for the sake of your baby face and well-tailored businessman suit. You have to convince them. People have flexible opinions about you and to make them join your group, you have to act accordingly.  You can either complete their quests, protect them from raids and deal with someone they dislike to make them respect you, or pick the correct approach with your dialogues and bribe them with rare trinkets (e.g. chocolates, wine, books etc.) to make them like you. Only then, you can have enough influence on them to make them join your group. Map is huge. And it is not empty at all. I need to say that I am really surprised with finding so much content here, as there are various events/characters/loot all around the map and this encourages discovering. Even when it gets really hard with lots zombies around, you know that you'll find something significant in that area and it definitely makes up to your effort.Story progression is in a way that teaches you the mechanics of the game, which is appropriate as the game has so many things to do and you need to get to the end step-by-step. You also get to recruit people, explore the world and have better equipment with side quests, alongside with getting in the middle of conflicts between the factions and overall the intriguing plot.   According to your play style, game almost always allows you to choose between a diplomatic and a violent approach. Every choice you make show it's unique consequence in story progression. While you may find it more beneficial to rock the boat and loot loads of corpses for items, recruiting people instead of killing them makes your group bigger and thus, increases your chance to survive. The game has a simple, strategy-game style of base building system. You need to have tools, materials and builders for building. You build houses, barns and wells for the needs of your group; and walls, watchtowers and pillboxes for the protection of your settlement. Protection around the settlement has to be set strategically, as there will be numerous zombie/rebel raids against your settlement and they get more frequent with the increasing population. The game sets a great balance for protection issues. If you assume that you will be perfectly safe after building wooden walls around your settlement, I am afraid you will soon find out how long it takes for a molotov coctail to burn down wood.  Protection is not the only issue. You need resources for your group. While you can usually find plenty of water around, food is not that easy to come by and you will quickly run out at some point. The game introduces another asset here: farming. This is also well implemented; you manage to feed your group with the food you scavenge around until the time you have access to crops/farming and after that, all you need to do is tasking some members of your group with farming and wait.  With more population, the amount of crops you have to plant also increases. I believe these are enough for convincing people this game is amazing in terms of its RPG and sandbox factors.Shooting mechanics are not hard if you follow some simple rules: stand still, aim and wait for the crosshair, shoot. Spraying is only a waste of bullets. The more you use weapons, you earn experience and get your firearms level up, this allows you to use more weapons and makes you shoot more effectively. Sound effects and graphics are quite good for an indie game; I haven't had any staggers or graphical glitches despite the huge map with various interactive elements.  The only negative I could think of would be the controls. They are kind of way-out and this may make the game seem tedious first, however I got used to them in my first two hours and understood the way things work, so it's not really a big issue if you are interested in playing the game. TL;DRI am simply amazed by the content I got from this game. Really well-made and fascinating in many aspects. Brilliant as a RPG, a survival, a sandbox and in the end, for this price, this game is a steal. Kudos to the developers for getting it right with their first game. I can't recommend this enough.Edit: Nominated for the “I Thought This Game Was Cool Before It Won An Award” award.

												Potential, but it's really irritating that whenever I get attacked, a window pops up that stops me from moving, but doesn't pause the game, so I get injured, infected or killed.Every time I die, the auto save saves as I'm dying, so it keeps looping me to that point. I have to rush to exit to the main menu or else it just infinite loops. It seems programmed to do this. It has been EVERY time. Literally.The map is zoomed in so far that it's very difficult to see your surroundings. The zombies pounce you before you see them coming.There are quests to carry items... but items that are so heavy that you can only carry one at a time. However, the quest requires that you carry at least a dozen of the item, so you have to take a long time going back and forth to get all this crap.Getting infected is too easy, finding antigens is rare and most infections infect you so fast that even if you have the antigen, good luck using it before you're dead.If you are very injured and have bandages in your inventory, you can't use them. Sometimes it will randomly use bandages automatically.This could be fun, but there are too many problems.Pros: The zombies basically hump your brains out, which is sort of funny.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2015
												Don't dismiss this as yet another zombie survival game - this is a hidden gem which is well worth a look.There are so many great ideas - recruiting survivors, building a community (each of whom you can give orders to or control directly) relationships with every character which are tracked and affected by your actions, a variety of quests, building, crafting... While the game is somewhat linear, there are a few different endings and various ways to achieve them which adds replayability to a game which already has plenty of playtime potential.The graphics are functional, and while the isometric view is a bit limited, the cinematic window is a great touch. Some of the music tracks are earworms, if a bit grating after a while. The best bit is the writing, which is often amusing and occasionally touching.There's plenty of content and good ideas here for a low price.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
												I got this game for 3 Euro during it's most recent sale and I'm glad I did. It's a really fun, open world game that feels quite unique compared to a lot of zombie games I've previously played. There are plenty of quests to keep you busy and you will also need to build defences at your base to keep looters and undead hordes away. Switching and controlling different characters is fairly straight forward and allows you to multi task with the members of your group with ease. Sometimes leaving group members to do tasks you've given them can get put off due to the character deciding he/she needs to find food/water first before continuing their task even when they're not overly hungry or thirsty. However, I think it's fair to say that this is the biggest problem I have with the game which isn't much of a problem, just a nuisance from time to time. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who's looking for a simulation zombie game to put a decent amount of time into. To anyone who is interested in the game but not entirely sure on whether to buy the game or not, be sure to try the demo. It's what made my mind up
