number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
SurvivalistZombies? Check.Post-Apocalyptic Wasteland? Check.Base Building? Check.It all sounds very cliche, but it's pulled off - well. Instead of being focused on 1 area, it takes bits and pieces from each genre and creates a game that's worth playing, and definitely worth the price tag.Audio: ★★★★☆ [4/5]Well constructed music and sounds' guns sound like they pack a punch, panting when fatigued, the grunts and shuffling noises of the undead, lurking in the fog. The music is good, however some seems misplaced (too upbeat when you've just seen your community slaughtered, for example)Graphics: ★★★★☆ [4/5]Obviously, nobody is expecting top of the line graphics here, yet doing it like this has it's charm. It's cartoon-like appearance helps take away from the harshness of the surroundings, whilst still immersing you in what's going on around you. Some of the animations could of been improved though, however, for an indie game, personally graphics don't matter too much.Gameplay: ★★★★★ [5/5]Gameplay is a very important feature; the most important you could say. The gameplay is done flawlessly. Base building, whilst it could be expanded, is simple. The UI is easy to navigate, which is handy when you've got zombies swarming around you, with that looter party in the horizon getting ever closer. Guns are well thought out, and whilst slightly limited, each serves a role with perks and drawbacks for each. The RPG elements keep the game fresh, and keep you on your toes as to who is the best man for the job.Options: ★★★☆☆ [3/5]A range of languages to choose from and rebinding keys are big pro's for an indie game. However, the options menu's are let down by the lack of Graphical options (Resolution, Full-screen, and 60fps are your only options) and the sound sub-menu, whilst efficient and clear, when turning everything down to 0, some noises are still audible (such as panting).Overall: ★★★★☆ [4/5]PRO'S Gameplay is fresh Quests are well executed and tie the story well Sandbox style means you're not limited to said quests Base building is simple and effective Characters stories and skills are well thought out-CON'SReplayability can be lacking if not following questsCertain characters problems (certain characters lung cancer or Alice's insulin need can take away from the fun.-SUGGESTIONSHouses; some buildings have more than 1 entry/exit, however characters must always enter and exit through 1 door.Ability to synthesize anti-gen's. Similar to the crafting system for bandages / molotov cocktails, could possibly craft certain antigens, with the rarer strains requiring rarer materials.Perhaps a more "dead-end" start zone to help minimize attack casualties early on, or the ability to deconstruct, then, using concrete, build a new bunker.

content:
Posted: February 4, 2015
												I'm coming up to my first hour in this game, and I can make the early insinuation that it is going to be a hit.Admittedly, not for everybody. This post-apocalyptic zombie arcade game offers more than you'd actually of expected. I feel like I've made at least a £10 under-payment. There is so much content just wedged in to such an un-renown, outlandish game. It lacks polish in the combat, and sometimes it can throw an abundance of haste zombies at you- which can be rather profuse, and irritating. The RPG elements to this game are fantastic, and I've really found myself getting drawn in to Joe Wheeler's character. If you have somebody in your group which is diabetic, you need insulin; if somebody in your group has been bitten, you need to inject yourself with some toxin, which has to be the parallel colour of the zombie's eyes who bit you. There's also a Sims-like command system which works spectacularly.I'm just getting to a part where you can fortify your base- yes, you build and fortify your own base too. Another feature which isn't intricate, and easy to pick up.For £3.99 you can NOT go wrong with Survivalist.I'm looking forward to my future endeavours. Well done developers for making a zombie game which isn't overhyped, and doesn't suck.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												This is one of those good ole very hard to start but once you get started gets easier kind of rpgs. Survivalist is a top-down shoopter with rpg elements. As I first stated in the begining dont expect to run to your nearast town and rambo your way through. It wont happen. This is a in depth (in my opinion which may be crap to your) real survival game. No your not Bear Gryilles (or what ever that crap his last name is) eating poop and drinking pee. But you do have to manage food, water, sleep, etc. Also on top of that you have to manage Alice's type 1 diebetes. YAY, which means your'll constantly be running around looking for food and water and insulin. As I said this isn't easy starting off. As all games should be,  in the beggining your gonna be moslty scaveging for food and water and ammo and insulin. Then you'll head back to the bunker to start making your camp. Here's where it starts getting intense. Now your'll have to juggle using only one survivor Joe. For the time being. So that means you'll have to split food,water,ammo,and else. But enough rambling. Once you finally start builgind a comminuty the real action starts. I found myself constantly getting attacked while i was building or away. SO now your gonna have to start getting wood, and metal to secure your small comunity. As you start to accumulate more and more in your community your begin to realize hey I dont have to scavenge as often i have farms and wells. While ammo and insulin and building supplies now on the top of the GOT GET IT ALL list. Soon your'll feel safer leaving your comminuty alone from time to time knowing hey anything comes close ole buckeye pete and his m16 will gun it down. Of corse nothing is invincble but you'll feel better knowing raiders cant burn down chain-link fences. Soon the game gets easy for the time till it catches up with harder zombies. Now with that talk of coop it makes tingle inside knowing I can be guarding my community while someone else scavages. So I rate this a 9/10 IGN very very fun but gets kinda repetitive. Very hard early one. But hard fun.? (sounded better in my head). I would reccomend you get this. But learn to come and love the restart button

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
												If you like the survival/zombie genre then this game is a must buy! Fantastic game, with individual character development, tons of potential NPC allies and enemies, expansive map to explore, good story, etc. It goes on sale for a mere couple of bucks, often, which is really just stealing money from the folks who deserve more for a really well made game. If you are on the fence, then spend the few bucks to pick this up; you'll probably be surprised you hadn't discovered it sooner!Pros:+Interesting/original spin on the zombie outbreak scenario. Fast zombies suck but are awesome.+Lots of NPCS hidden around the desert, mostly in small enclaves to interact with. Hostile humans can often be turned around to become neutral, or even join your group, if you play your cards right.+Base building is balanced; the buildings and upgrades give benefits comparable to the work required to construct them.+Finite, if generous, quantities of building materials rewards careful selection for base location and smart construction of buildings.+Anyone who gets taken by an infected becomes an infected; you'll find former friends and enemies have become the very zombies that are now attacking you!+Individual character development, with uncomplicated stats and skills.+World changes as you play; NPC enclaves will eventually succumb to wandering bands of bandits and zombies, including side-quest locations and even groups of hostile survivors end up perishing over time.+Reasonable graphics, the game has very modest system requirements.+Good replay value; it is quite a long game and can be played through several times.A real nice touch is that the NPC's appear to have the same rules as the player characters; everyone needs food, water, and sleep. If the NPC's that do the farming of an enclave or group die then the other members will start travelling the desert in search of provisions. It also usually leads to the death of everyone else in that group as their members individually run zombies they can't handle. Then they become zombies and help polish off the next desperate survivor who leaves the camp in search of food. The bandit groups might be an exception to this, hostile survivors that cannot be negotiated with, seem to never move and have no resources close by to sustain them. They stay awake for months at a time, with no food or water, the true zombies of the apocalypse!Cons:-Character development, while effective, is quite simple. It may be part of the charm but it feels like some lost potential.-Base building can be pretty tedious when trying to gather resources from remote locations. Your runners either constantly run to the point of exhaustion(extremely vulnerable to zombies!!!) or walk about at a casual pace.-Unable to create groups of runners for salvaging/gathering. Having to select each individual survivor and send them out to collect resources is a nuisance. These survivors all function separately, instead of working as team, out in the field. Lots of times a survivor gets mauled by a couple of zombies that they've encountered while one or two other survivors, also travelling to the same destination, are within a screen's distance and do not go to the aid of their fellow survivor. The only work around I found was to assign guards to each runner, which works, but wastes a lot of carrying potential.-As above, you have to micromanage your survivors out in the field. Lone survivors are no match for two or more zombies at a time. Even teams of two, with a dedicated guard, tend to get overwhelmed pretty easily. It wouldn't be much of problem except they tend to be much less effective when AI controlled so you have to be quite vigilant. If your main group is also dealing with an encounter, it is very easy to miss a runner in trouble.This is a great game and would easily be worth $20-$25, especially to fans of the genre! I've stayed up far later than I should on many a weekday to just get a bit more "Survivalist" time in!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 5, 2015
												What a lovely little gem. I almost feel guilty for buying it at such a low price. I was very pleasantly surprised to learn just how fun and... honestly kind of complex this game is. PROS:* Great gameplay. Combat can feel a bit repetitive, but being able to cap a zombie in the leg to prevent the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ from jumping you is pretty good. I also really like the skill progression, though it can feel like a grind at times. There's homesteading, zombie shooting, looter shooting, quest taking, micro-management somewhat akin to RTS games, building a huge posse of fellow survivors, exploration... lots of content in this game. * Content. I'm still kind of baffled just how rich this game is for its price tag. 30 hours in and I still am not done with my first playthrough. I'd say that's pretty impressive. Along the same lines, the RPG elements are pretty solid. I was amused to see that characters respond to just about anything you do to them or others in their community. If you so desired, you could just wiped everyone out with extreme prejudice, or you could be more of a peacemaker and try to recruit as many people as you can... including bandits. I'm somewhere in between. People even remember you being RUDE to them. *Game design. The author of this game clearly went to great lengths to implement depth and replayability. There are three game winning scenarios that the player can choose from, people to save or not save, quests to take or not take, and just the fact that you can't please everyone in the game makes it so that you can easily boot it back up and try a different path. -----CONS:Honestly... I can't think of many serious problems with this game other than a few minor nitpicks, but there are two things that bother me in particular-* Ear-bleeding music. UGH. The soundtrack in this game is just hideous. I've played most of it with it muted. It's a minor gripe, I suppose, but still. *The allied AI can sometimes be a bit bone-headed... like they may wander away from the path of safety just to make a shortcut (and bumping into zombies and looters along the way), they waste time sometimes by wandering around FOREVER looking for food or water when they could just complete their ♥♥♥♥ing jobs and go back to base to eat and drink. ----All in all, VERY solid game. I highly recommend it. The price tag certainly helps me say that it's worth every penny.

												Stunning, enough said...PROS- Interesting Characters,All quest characters are killable, meaning you can even abondon your freinds and kill them, and still keep playing.Fun RPG ElementsA Fallout Reference (You will find it when you play the game)Dynamic story, what you do, actually matters and changes the story, which I personally love.Great GunplayGood item looting and currency system (gold) in the gameCONS- Clunky and almost unuasable building systemGarbage MultiplayerCocktails are useless (as well as many other weapons, *cough cough, assualt rifle)It gets very repetitve to micromanage everyone in your communityGets boring after playing around an hour at a time (good for short burst sessions)Conclusion: I like it, it is a fun and challenging game, sadly though the multiplayer beta isn't worth a test, there are connection issues and bugs like there is no thing, I feel like a more multiplayer oriented dev should handle multiplayer, but the singleplayer is really fun, it is easily worth 25 USD at least, but for around $5, this game is a steal.Score: 7.5/10

content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
Excellent Game.Grabbed this game on sale; with low expectations, but let me tell you now, I very much regret underestimating this game.If you want to know what this game is about, it's basically a Top down survival game; with relative realism, as there is hunger dehydration and sleep deprivation to worry about, as well as being infected from zombies and bleeding out.Good Stuff: Easy to learn to play; whilst not being too simple(I just found this really cool, but) If you are bleeding, you can use a bandage to stop the bleeding, but you can't just spam them and heal faster.Cool NPCS with good, but brief backstoriesPlenty of quests and characters to meetBad Stuff: Small amount of weapons (but it keeps it simple so It could be a pro)I personally found building a little bit tricky, as the tutorial was a little hard to understandI also often had the problem of my teammates or NPCs walking into me and popping up with the chat menu when I didn't really want toAnother thing was the builder guy you encounter at the beginning of the game as I had trouble getting him to do what I wanted, he didnt seem to listenOverall: I'd give this game a solid 9/10, It just needed a tiny bit of polishing, and hey, I don't usually bother to review games, so do with that what you will!It's a steal on or off sale!

content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
												Day 1: I've ran out of captain crunch and hershey bars I must venture out in the world for supplies. Day 2: Found a man and a woman, the guy's okay but the woman is diabetic she asked me to go get insulin at a nearby fort. Day 3: We're holed up in my old bunker and the guy built a wall and a gate around us. Day 4: We went to scavenge an undisovered town but soon discovered a group of bandits were living there. We threatened them after doing favors from them, we ow have 4 new members in our group the surivalists. Day 5: All food I eat tastes like captain crunch, even the corn Alice the diabetic started growing with her nose in that book. Day 6: My only builder smoked ONE PACK OF CIGARETTES for his FIRST TIME he now has lung caner. Day 7: We couldn't afford the insulin for Alice anymore so we told her to leave the group. I knew she couldn't survive out there alone so I shot her in the back of the head with my shotgun. There is no Captain Crunch corn left now. Day 8: I am now a bad@ss and cannot die by bullets for some reason. Anyways we shot up a bandit camp and got a wimp to join us. Day 9: We got half of Fort Kohai to join us. Day 10: We stole from Fort Kohai. I did not save. I brought my entire group. I WAS PLAYING HARDCORE SO I DID NOT SAVE THE ENTIRE GAME. We were caught stealing them. An old lady pulled out a shotgun and shot Bob the Smoking Builder. I sprinted as far as I possibly could into the fort with my group ad than a message appeared on my screen: YOU ARE NOW AT WAR WITH FORT KOHAI. Day 11: Half of my group was slaughtered by them. We are low on bandages and food. We are at war with Kohai. We will fight back. Day 12: We molotov torch Fort Kohai and shoot up everyone inside from far away with our sniper rifles. A man surrenders, he looks like Lucas Simms from Fallout 3. He begs for mercy and he'll even join us because we've proved. I the said "This is for Bob the Builder!" And we all sprayed a giant wave of bullets into his torso he quickly fell on the ground. We had won. We had beat Fort Kohai.  We were invincible and victorious. Day 13: We all die of starvation, we forgot to get a farmer assigned or loot the farms at Kohai. 10/10 The Real "Don't Starve"

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 11, 2016
												Better Bang for your Buck than Fallout 4: More Realistic Survival Scenarios: Your character must constantly satisfy hunger and thirst, as well as constantly fend off hostile survivors and zombies.  Wounds require bandaging quickly, or you'll bleed to death.  A bite from a zombie requires a speedy shot of antigen, which often isn't available (making a zombie bite the death sentence it ought to be).  Choosing the right balance of equipment with weight limitations is a constant challenge.  Better Moral Dilemmas: Would you be willing to murder a doctor or a random survivor to steal insulin for a member of your party? Do you have time to work odd jobs to make the gold to buy a shot of insulin to make her last a few more days? Can you accept a survivor into your party knowing that he is an outlaw in a town you frequent? Multiplayer: Unlike Fallout 4, there is actually a multiplayer mode in this game.  Like Destiny, the multiplayer co-operative  is meant to blend seamlessly into the singleplayer experience.  Unlike Destiny, Survivalist properly executes on this feature.  The chat log is extremely handy.  You can't go wrong with this game at full prce, or on sale, buy it now!!

content:
Posted: May 9, 2015



YouTube™ Video: Cheap PC Games: Survivalist Review 

			Views: 2,145		

			https://indiegamestand.com/store/1272/survivalist/ http://store.steampowered.com/app/340050/ Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Little_B_Gaming		

The written review is way too long and can't post the whole review here, so you have to watch my video for complete information about the gameAre you getting tired from games with zombies? Yes? Well, i'm certainly not. This game have zombies and it's a top-down shooter with light crafting and strategy to spice things up.The game takes place in the near future, one year after the collapse of civilization. You take the role of John Wheeler, a wealthy L.A. manager, who own a underground bunker in the middle of the desert, filled with food and water for 1 year, in which you took refuge. On the 364 day in he picked up signal for help on his radio, coming from somewhere near by. He goes out to investigate . You find woman named Alice locked, you help her and the rest is up to you to find out. Half way through the game story picks up and starts to get interesting and it have few twists.Usually in a game like this, the is goal to find out, where the disease started, find a cure or save someone. Here it's not like that. Your first priority is surviving. Some quests will lead to answers. To reach the end of the game, you have complete five objectives: construct certain number and type of buildings, enough food for feeding your people, neutralize all regional treats, find love, have at least one person in your community with max skill level in each of: Fitness, Firearms, Construction, Farming and Medicine.The game was first introduce for Xbox Live before landing on the PC platform and it's almost perfect port. The most disappointing thing are the video options. Only fullscreen, resolution and large fonts. Textures are okay, movement of everyone is kind of robotic. All human and zombie characters differ from each other only by the clothes and skin color. In Sound there are only 3 options – sound effects, menu sound and music. But all those things are minor problems, the game is indie and it's awesome!However, the developer did make mouse and keybord controls perfect. So many variations in Controls menu. I was really surprised by this. And of course all keys can be rebind. You can even play with a controller if you like.Next is gameplay. Here is where the game shines a lot. I'll start with the base. After rescuing Alice, you find out she have diabetes and she need constant supply of insulin. Through the hole game you will either have to buy it or searching for abandoned pharmacies. You and Alice are heading to the nearest town and there Isham, another survivor, will join you and decide John's bunker will be your base. Here you will find the strategy part and it's giving orders to your people. And what are they? To bring supplies to your base and build. So, Isham is constructs, Alice is carrying and you complete quests. In the beginning you can only build shack outhouse, wooden and wire fences, gates and wooden watch tower. After gaining few levels in Construction it will unlock more things – barn, well, concrete tower and pillbox. All buildings will improve the life of your people. Don't make wrong conclusions. For the most part this is  action oriented game, with nice story and it's not another with only crafting and surviving.The game wants from you to build certain number and type of buildings. That way you will have places for everyone and everything. More people you have, more buildings you need. They are used to store supplies and for people to sleep. Of course, you need to defende your base. That's way you have watch towers and pillboxes. When someone is inside them, it's more hard to shoot them.One extremely important elemnt of the game is feeding your community and supplying them with water. In the first few hours they will eat cans and chips and water you can be found in dead bodies, buildings and water towers. But there is easier way for providing  both of them. After the mentioned hours, you can plant crops. This way you will have constant supply of food. And if you don't want to search for water, build a well. It's also used for watering the crops.You can take control of every single person in your community and make them do what the game allows you to do. I was quite surprised by the AI. When you give an order, there is no need to babysit them. When someone is thirsty or hungry, he goes where you store food and water. If don't have them in your base, he/she is searching for you. If he wants to sleep, he goes to a building alone and after it's done, continues his task from where he stoped . Builder don't have enough materials? He goes to the nearest dicovered place to get them. Sometimes suppliers encounter 1 or 2 zombies and they deal with them without a problem. You don't need to take control over them, unless they are big group. If this is the case – you better rum. I didn't rely entirly on the AI and you don't have to. While people sleep, I feed them and give them water and supplies. Sometimes I take control if something attack them. Simple, but effective.Every single person have 5 skills to develop: Fitness, Firearms, Constuction, Farming and Medicine. Level 5 is the top, but not all characters can, they are just limited. Only when using certain skill, you gain experience for it. For example – using a weapon will increase Firearms. There is artificial way for gaining levels. You will find books for the respective skill and the only requirement is to carry them all the time.On the right side is shown the person you control, mini map (there is big map also), what weapon he uses, does he have bulletproof vest and fatigue. If you run for too long, the character is getting tired and you better stop on one place or just walk, because if you run it to a zombie or looter, it will be hard to fight them.There are few stats, that you need to keep an eyeon them. They are hunger, thirts, for smokers lung cancer, for Alice glucose level. When you walking or running without a break, people don't eat or drink water, so keep in mind to stop for e brief moment.If you want to get somewhere quickly or people sleep and you don't have anything to do, speed up the game. But there is a risk. When you are in this mode and you control someone and zombie attack the character, you may not push it on time and this have consequences.The map is huge and dangerous, but there are friendly communities. From them you will get quests. Most of them are just killing looters. All communities have traders. From them you can buy a lot of stuff or sell. The currency here is gold. You will get it from searching buildings, cars, bodies and completing quests. The first thing you need to buy is backpack. It will let you carry more stuf with you. The bigger backpack and higher level of Fitness will allow to take more things with you.You have total of 6 weapons – pistol, shotgun, assault rifle, sniper, RPG and Molotov. The shooting is as follows: you hold the right mouse button to lock-on target. For more accurate shots you have to stay in one place for the crosshair to turn red. But if you are not moving, you are sitting duck. Bigger the Firearms level, fastert the crosshair turns red. It's fun to shoot with every weapon. They don't have recoil, but even if you have highest level of Firearms, doesn't guarantee every single shot to hit the target. Don't expect to get RPG right from the beginning. You will start with pistol. For him it's easy to find ammo, but it gets progressively harder to find for the better weapons. While the target is lock-on, you can choose with the mouse to shoot it in the legs, torso or head. They have their advantages and disadvantages. The head is harder to be hit, but guarantees quick kill. The torso is easy to hit, but you do less damage. Shooting the legs leads zombies to limp and generally slow them down.

The combat mechanics kill this game!  Basically combat in this game can be summed up as: walking along and a lightning fast zombie charges you from of in the fog of war and instantly attacks you giving you little to no time to react, aim, or even properly defend yourself which turns this into an instant button mashing game.  Fix the combat system, or at least offer a setting to adjust it, and you might have a decent zombie game here.

Posted: August 27, 2016
												Current version of the game... it cuts frame rate in half for a long period of time every time you save, and sometimes even when you're just opening the inventory and such. I write this review while my game sits on a seemingly unending loading screen instead of taking me to my start menu it took me to a loading screen? And I'm hearing gun fire.. which suggests it's still running while I have this indefinite loading screen. This is not alpha, it's a fully released game. Do I think it's fun? Yes. On that note would I recomend it? No. It's far too laggy with too many annoyingly pointless effects. For example the menu doesn't just open, it all peices together quickly but what's the point of having a flashy start menu? And every option you hover over pulses on top of already changing color! Getting past that... this game feels to me what I was expecting from Project Zomboid and didn't get. Just wish the lag wasn't so bad. My PC can run ARK on max with out a melt down and still rocking almost 60 fps. And I can't save on a tiny game with out dropping me to 30? Jeezus.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
												This game would seem interesting if you read about it. Unfortunately, the controls and interface are non-intuitive in the extreme. The player wanders about with no sense of direction or purpose, and has little interaction with the world around him. Enemies overtake you in an unpredictable manner, and you must "aim" at them on the one hand, and then "attack" them using an altogether separate control system. I'd really enjoy a game like this if it were fun, but I'd recommend better-designed "post-apocalyptic" games. Not to specifically "plug" a game, but a hint as to the name would be "the resulting devastation after nuclear war that has an amazing half-life." Another hint is that you're raised in a vault safely underground and leave to see what the outside world looks like. Even if this game were on a terrific sale, steer clear of it. In good conscience I cannot recommend this game.

content:
Posted: April 13, 2016
												The game will not start for me. Here is the error log:Application: Survivalist.exeFramework Version: v4.0.30319Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.Exception Info: System.IO.FileNotFoundException   at ZombieApocalypse.Program.Main(System.String[])I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling to no avail.This error is no longer occuring after I tried the solution provided by the Dev and a few other solutions. Now this one is: Application: Survivalist.exeFramework Version: v4.0.30319Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.Exception Info: System.BadImageFormatExceptionat ZombieApocalypse.Program.Main(System.String[])im running .net framework 4.6.1 if that mattersHere is an update to this review. After fixing the issue (The developer was awesome in helping with this). I started off playing coop. It was a great time with my wife who decided to micromanage my community. I absolutely love the possibilities here in this game. You can be a lone gun and only play for yourself (no time limits or urgencies except for the beginning) or you can build a huge community and deal with everyone's problems (pretty realistic). If you enjoy micromaging things than this is your game. If you enjoy scary post apocalyptic settings than this is your game.In all honesty I have played the "big box" games that cost $60 on release and none of them compare to this game which is still being developed. The story behind any of the paths you choose is astounding for a choose your own adventure sort of game. Survivalist really hit the nail on the head.10/10 would blow up felipe's house with a rocket launcher again.10/10 would run my 60 member community into the enemy base with just pistols and molotovs.3/10 would want to meet a diabetic in the real world apocolypse

												I sold a bullet proof vest for a backpack to carry more.But I could only afford the Fuzzy wuzzy pink rabbit backpack....10/10 would never speak of this againin seriousness its a strangely addictive top down survival - do quests build a base - I love the ability to set up friendlys to forage and do looting automatically using all the chars in my team not just the ones in my party - for 5$ its a must have for sandbox/survival fans - quests include getting anti zombie drugs or a steady supply of insulen for your type 1 diabetic follower - balance out food ammo water and carry weights to make it pretty challenging - better then some 60$ games I've played Cons - the controls are a bit wierd I'm used to E being activate but its switch follower here and left mouse button is activate which feels a bit strange at first but you get used to it - the fatigue sound gets on my nerves and I feel early game carry weight is a bit low but thats about it for my complaints so far

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												Had no idea such a simple game on the surface could be so darn addicting in execution. Think State of Decay meets Project Zomboid mixed with 28 Days later zeds  and you got the gist. Building up a community is fun and engaging. Even the..ahem...complications with one of the starting chracters I found made the game more compelling when it could easily have been bloody irritating. So kudos devs for taking a creative chance there.What really makes this game for me however is command mode. Basically, you can go into a Sims style overworld view to tell chracters your not directly controlling what to do. Gather resources, build, or whatever. And the best part is you don't have to micro-manage every little thing! They need food or water? They find it! They need more materials for that build? They head to the nearest cache and grab materials. And mostly they intelligently defend themselves (wouldn't suggest letting them auto into looters though. That never seems to end well).All in all, a fantastic game especailly given the price. And the recently added multi-player serves only to give it more replayability. I would highly suggest this one to anyone more interested in community interactions with their zombie survival instead of just scavaging and waiting to die.Oh, and last note. The combat I find to be extremely engrossing. The fast paced zeds and erratic nature of shoot-outs with looters will keep you entertained!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												I normally do not enjoy these types of games but I thought for the price why not? I was plesantly surprised. I bought this yesterday and have since racked up ten hours. It is a good blend of role playing, base building, and zombies. I really like the command view which allows you to order members of your party to do a certain repetative task (gathering supplies, building, etc) so that the user isn't wasting time going back and forth to do those things. Thoroughly enjoyable and I recommend it. What you're getting for $4.99 is hours and hours of entertainment. The open sand-box type set up of the game ensures you will have plenty of replay value.

number of helpful: 12 of 26 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2016
												Listen. I understand if some of you like this game, but it just didn't click with me.Let's get this over with.+ open world zombie game+ has a lot of RTS elements - you collect resources, build your own base, recruit survivors and protect it from raiders+ multiple endings and many choices+ quests can be completed in all kinds of ways+ generally very open-ended - do the main quests or just wander around the desert and expand your base.Now I get mean.- HORRIBLE MUSIC. I mean, seriously! When I play a zombie game I expect something dark and heavy, some rock, maybe metal. Heck, western tunes would fit with the setting of the game. But instead you get some music made by teenage boys that would fit more for Unturned (no offense for Unturned btw, it's a great game). But yeah, you're walking around the desert killing zombies, and then... ugh. I have no words.- the graphics. I understand that this is a low budget indie that started as a small game for consoles. If you have a weak laptop, then you may like it. But for me? I'm not a "graphics are everything" guy, but... nah.- the animations. Check out how the character walks. This is a placeholder from a prototype, not a fully relased game you pay money for.- the combat. This is pretty much a twin-stick shooter, but there's something very important. You don't aim manually, intead when you draw the gun the game just locks on to whatever is in front of you. And this is really annoying when your ally is getting eaten and you just lock on to all the zombies swarming around you but not the one you need to shoot.- the infection. If you get bit, you get infected. When that happens, you need a cure. But there are different kinds of zombies, and each one requires a different cure. Remember the previous part? Yeah. You know what happens. What's worse is that cures are pretty hard to find, and they are used automaticaly. Now for example a green infection takes a few days to kill you. It doesn't really weaken you in any way, but instead of saving it when you will really need it, you will just jam it right away and then probably get bit again.-t    h    e     f   r  a   m  e   r   a   t  e. Now that's the worst part about the game. In 60 FPS the game runs in slow motion. Now there's a reason for that: enemies move pretty fast, so you need some time to react. I would understand if this slo-mo activated in combat, but it will be on even when there's no enemies around you and you're just walking to the nearest town. And with slow motion, it will take ages. Meanwhile when you turn on 30 fps, slow motion disappears, and you now move much faster. This is better, right?Right?NO! Zombies are not slow like the old-school ones, they run at the speed of light at you, then they leap at you draining a lot of stanima forcing you to knock them off. If you're in 60 fps, you can actually dodge the leap and watche the zombie gracefully fly right past you in slow motion and slowly ragdoll on the ground. But if you're in 30 fps, you get no time to react and get grabbed and molested repeatably untill you get bit and probably killed. It's worse when you're fighting enemies with guns, because then you will be literally showered with bullets and killed befoe you even think about getting to cover.That's enough. You get the message. Some people like it. That's fine. I think it's just plain awful. I regret wasting my money on it.Just buy Left 4 Dead 2.And if you want "base building with zombies", one word: Terraria.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
												I cannot actually remember when I bought this game. I played it at last because... it updated.Top-down combat that's not very good. You can't see zombies before they're running at you. Your companions get to do gun combat. YOU get to lie under a zombie and kick it off. Since you have to shoot things to get better at shooting things... I was hoping, from the other reviews, that there was some reason to keep playing. But action combat with RPG stats in this case is purely translating to "you are bad at this, and it's the part of the game that isn't walking". And I thought, from all the positive reviews that the writing would make up for the graphics. It doesn't. I'm facing characters that are more lifeless than the ♥♥♥♥ing zombies, who at least have expressions.The game also does a thing I really can't stand. It's the opposite of handholding... blindfolding. You have to advance the story to gain the power to hit f4 and bring up the map. That's not nice. It means if I try to explore at all, I'm going to get lost, and probably get someone killed.I could probably forgive the hell out of a lot of these things if it were 2D... and/or turn-based instead of some anti-fun action combat where the game unhelpfully suggests dodging to the "side" while you're DOING that, but when the zombie's close, wasd with lock-on means you're barely moving.

content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
												It pains me to give this a negative review. It's exactly what I want in a game: survival and resource management but in a large, populated world with a sharp narrative. Unfortunately, the command mode UI is impossible. Telling people what to do is complicated, telling them where to go is complicated, and once that's done they have a bad habit of dying anyways, interrupting the quest you're personally overseeing. Commanding people needs to be done paused, outside the environment of the rest of the game, and their AI needs to be smarter or you need to be given notifications, or something. This game was apparently made by one person, and I 100% commend them for the effort and hope that they continue to develop this and other games; it's just that one major flaw makes this, for me, unplayable.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 7, 2015
												I mean in reality it could just be walking simulator, or maybe even exhaustion simulator don't get me wrong its a very great title and it was very fun to play but most of the game is either walking, killing things to easy to pose a challenge or running from things that are to much of a challenge, not to mention the fact zombie's can literally reach you from 5 feet away. honestly I normally don't like the idea of fast travel in games as they encourage laziness but this game needs fast travel or some way other then running and dying or walking and never getting there.Quests in this game take what seems like years, you get a simple mission to kill a group of raiders and then the person reveals that the raiders are actually 20 miles away and you've never seen this area before, now if raiders are 20 miles away how are they bothering you.The realism in this game makes my dark heart glow a little because you actually have to assign a person to water crops, you have to assign a person to bring supplies and you have to assign people for everything, but the realism is killed when the game stats that one person cannot carry more then one log as it weighs the persons wait, I don't know if the developers have ever lifted a plank of wood, but it doesnt weigh a god damn person.Overall this game was worth the money I paid, a whooping 27 cents, I use coupons on a lot of stuff, I don't believe the game would be worth the 5.49$ CDN for a running simulator. but if that is what you're into then go ahead and purchase "Survivalist". 3/10

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												Damn...I just cannot handle games that aren't balanced and this "zombie" game just doesn't feel right. Im sure a lot of people will enjoy this game and I can't pretend it isn't priced right, but...... I think the devs need to learn a little more about the zombie world before their next attempt. I'm really not sure what they were thinking trying to combine a "state of decay" like game with infected zombies running at you from the dark fog in packs of 12 at 100mph when your sight range is about 25ft. You spend most of your time just trying to side step their massive jump lunges and kicking them off one after another when they do get you. It quite literally gets to the point of annoyance and repetitiveness so quickly, that I pretty much shut it off an hr in. I mean in what "fast moving zombie" movie like "28days" or "World War Z" do you see people carelessly just strolling down to the local store to collect chicken wire one piece at a time with the delusional goal of eventually building a fence that will stop this type of zombies. I mean come on....all zombie fans know the difference between the slow zombies and the fast zombies, along with how different survival tactics would be...well, except the people making this game apparently. Kinda sad that they came up with such a cool concept only to drop the ball in the end with one stupid flaw that actually changes the entire dynamic of the game.WHY CAN'T THEY JUST GET ONE OF THESE GAMES RIGHT!!

												Despite the premise which I always find enjoyable and the clever little character quips this game suffers from two major issues. First off the interface is rather anti-intuitive. number of helpful: 7 of 17 people (41%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 31, 2015
												For all the praise this game gets it has some glaring problems.The controls are very counter intuitive and will also cause you to mis-click many things since far to much is done with the same button.The same button you use to fire does almost everything else inscluding reloading a game when you don't even want to. Oddly the buttong you use to kick can cause the same problem.The quests will often beeline you into choices you never wanted to make. Such as trying to play as good person and being forced to be greedy for gold.The crafting and inventory lacks any depth at all, with crafting being basically an abandoned concept.Playing it is constantly frustrating and all of its good points have glaring problems.I honestly don't think there is one positive feature about this game that doesn't come with an annoying downside. Unless you count being cheap.Don't buy the game until the developer learns how to make it accesible at least. It gets lots of praise due to potential only not actual delivery.

number of helpful: 7 of 17 people (41%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5, 2015
												I can appreciate that this game is still in early development, but from what I see ...This game is azz:Horribly bad, outdated graphics (looks like Grand Theft Auto 1) and animationsThe music is cheesy and doesn't fit the mood in any way -- you'll instantly turn down your speakersThe Fog of War makes light-speed zombies practically impossible to dodge or hit -- Apparently people can't see farther that 5ft in front of them, in a desert, in sunlight, in the apocalypse.  The targeting system is virtually broken -- trying to aim at legs, torso and head is impossible by moving the mouse up and down ... when you have to move the mouse around to even pick a target.Of course, your AI teamates are stupid as all hell -- while they are John Rambos while traveling with you, good luck having them rest up and heal in the bunker while you make a supply run.  You'll be halfway through the run when the party memeber decides to disregard your orders, exit the bunker into a mob of zombies while unarmed and estentially getting eaten, thus ending your game.The savegame function is a joke:  Hey, your party memeber just committed suicide ... np quickload .... whoops ... the autosave dinged, literally, right as the partymemeber enters the middle of the mob.  At least you can watch her/him get eaten over and over and over ....Horrible, un-wieldly dialouge, inventory and command menus.  Just ... ridiculous.There's about 20 other reasons why this game sucks.  I can appreciate an indie game like this, especially for $5 ... but it's just horrible.  Fun idea; terrible execution.  Just give me your $5 and save yourself the hassle of this game.

Dead Frontier 3D, fast paced, none of that contagion crap, awarding at high levels/started off characters;though, it's a grind at lower/mid levels unless you have friends to enjoy the game with. Rebuild 2 fun to play and compare how well you did vs. your friends. high replayability until you know everything.[2-5 complete playthroughs]This game... Cons - White/Red strains, you're ♥♥♥♥ed if you get bit/hit while another zombie mounts you and you don't have medic to bandage and the required anti-gen[you'll be a zombie in 10/30 seconds] - Terrible inventory systems, starting weight, backpack rarity, info button[COME ON!!!], weight of items, no sorting, no categories.- Combat system, don't be low on stamina and sidestep zombies + how hard it is to make fast Zs into slow Zs, becomes boring.- 100% Infection rate for bites.- Anti-K+M system, this game seems like it was made for a controller setup, thankfully you can change the keys.[side to side for target selection | up/down for target area]- Horde/Bandit system, if you're going to do this then atleast have like 10 days before they come out and increasing in frequency once it gets closer to estimated endgame day.- Sleeping decrease rate way too slow, only game I would ever want a 1:1 time ratio is VR FPS.- FFW is too slow- Building material requirements + availablity.- No real gathering- Quests for gold/rep, but you don't even need them to complete the game?- Needy un-necessary companion, so you can purposefully kill to save yourself the trouble.- Quest A.I. abuse, never runs out of ammo, does get infected but only if 4+:1 without your help.- Overdone game genre, so people are expecting better quality instead of...this.- Medic heals one wound, but doesn't heal another allowing your character to slowly bleedout - got stuck in an infinite death loop because of this.- Graphics are actually comparable to JA 2; though, they had more detail...]- No VAs- Clunky skip system, why would you ever make MMB insert skip? can't double bind to space/enter?- Un-natural skill assessment of a corporate hedge fund manager?- Planting corn in the desert and FOOD PROFIT.- No option to self-heal although i've seen characters do it?- Laggy co-op partners wait system...- unclear injury warning system [your characters clothes can obscure the injury]- Farming doesn't work at times/character does nothing except stand in front of the well- Someone can have -80/100 approval for you, yet still stays in your community.- Infinite water from well.- No team-damage when aiming at a Z through allies.- People in your community can dislike eachother, but they never do anything about it.- Automatic gathering, they don't run then slow down & wait until stamina full then run again.- builders will automatically gather materials from unknown sources- Characters will idle while teamed up characters are being attacked around the corner/nearby- Zombies can't do anything if mobbed by a team of fists/kicks- Usefulness of wood after chickenwire/concrete stage | construction still uses wood in concrete setting stages- Possible racism? not a single asian character that i've seen through 3/4 of the game.- Getting stuck on cacti [plural of Cactus] Pros + 3-5$+ Questlines? Found a photograph of a old guy's daughter then returned only to have him die and the wife suddenly murders you because you found the photograph that caused his death[maybe]. You could prevent this if alice[psychiatrist] gave the photograph.+/- OST though after playing through the game it becomes incredibly annoying especially that high-shriek one.+ Time spent on creating a story/quests throughout the wasteland.+/- Save system 2 quicksaves, but you can get into an infinite death loop if you aren't warned.+ Fast loading+/- Co-op, but people leave you the moment you don't have a Mic & will often do things you don't like - running off somewhere getting bitten and injured.+ Moral Dilemmas+/- Some quests are selective by who does it otherwise negative consequences.[not enough of these to actually matter.]

												Played for 12 minutes, asked for a refund.I had high hopes for this game due to the positive recommendations and it was number 1 on my wishlist.  I thought they had mispriced the game as it appeared cheap for how good the reviews were.  Why I didn't enjoy the game and got this refunded:- The graphics were not great.  I can usually get past not having top graphics but this was a tough one.  Not good graphics for characters or scenery.- The controls were clunky for me. Too many keys, and requied use of mouse wheel when I'm on keyboard without a mouse.  You can reconfigure the keys, but there are a lot to reconfigure.- The combat system seemed weak - hard to target, and very quick and rushed combat without much skill only a few key presses at right moment.- A walker jumped at me at seemingly a few hundred miles an hour and not much I could do to react, especially with the clunky key pressing combat system.- One little attack and you keep having to use a bandage.- You pillage zombies to find ammo, guns and things?  They would really carry them?Yes the games cheap, I hoped undeservedly so, but it's cheap for a reason.  I just couldn't get into this one, I find other good value games a lot more addictive.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 20
												I am unimpressed with this game.   Obviously this  is a port from a console... X-Box or something, and it sure shows.  But that isn't the real problem.This game lacks depth.  It's basically a base builder/resource gather type game.  But it was too easy, so the developers threw in the twist that one of your starter colonists has diabetes, and you scramble like mad the first part of the game trying to buy/cheat/and steal your way to keep her in insulin so she doesn't die.  They try and make it moral dilemma, by throwing in marginally easier options to obtain the insulin early on, by stealing and causing trouble between two rival factions.The combats are mostly harmless once you aquire a couple shot guns.  Those that aren't are easy to steer clear of until you're ready.   One of the biggest problems with the game is the limited camara field of view.  There's no scroll out, and your primary character can see about 10 feet for some reason.  Zombies hurl themselves at you from off screen as you explore new areas, and this is what passes for a fun combat system for most of the game.The base building aspect is actually pretty well done, with a good balance between resources needed to construct new buildings.  Beyond that, there's not that much innovative with the game.  Simple graphics, a sound track that could have been ripped from some Euro-Electric rave, make the entire title feel like a PC one man indie title.Don't get me wrong, I'm all for indie games, but if you want a much funner and more engaging challange, try Rimworld or Judgement Apocalypes for PC.  Both titles have the depth and fun game play you'd expect for PC games.

content:
Posted: February 12
												This game is one of those games that looks like a cheap goodie, but it is really just cheap.Here's a breakdown of my gripes with it:-Shooting System: For those who have not played the game, the shooting mechanics are the longer you focus on a target, the better chance one has in hitting their target. My gripe with it is that it takes too long to aim, but some players of the game say that it gets better as you level up, which leads to my next gripe.-Leveling System: If you are going to make a terrible shooting system that gets better as you progress into the game, at least have it awarding more experience when you go into combat. I am not also going to spend time with each of my individual squad members grinding my way up just to make shooting managable. It gets boring and makes the game lame.-Inventory Management: I have no problem with list inventories and a weight system. I view it gives more depth, but please add a search function to them when I go to my bunker to get something. It would be helpful.-Community Micromanagement: I do not want to scroll through each of my individual cast to get to the one I care about. I know I can quickly switch between multiple people using F1's community menu, but it gets harder to manage when you have more and more members. At least make it managable by letting us chose who to cycle through.-Combat and Vision: The combat is alright when I am facing zombie enemies, but when multiple looters come and attack this is when the issues arise. There is no vision cone wich matches the viewing angle of the charater, so when doing medium range combat with the assult rifle. I had died multiple times to looters because I know that they are there, but the game would not render them because "They were out of my sight." I would not have a problem with this if the vision cone was longer from the eyes of the charater.I had alright hopes for this game, so I was not afraid to be disapointed. But if you want to feel boredem and small fustrations, this is the game I would recomend.

number of helpful: 4 of 16 people (25%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 19
												Its a good game so far as i have seen, however, i have some qualms.first off being the carry weight system. Carry weight is prevailent in alot of these games nowadays, but this one is by far done the worst of the ones ive seen. each character you get at start gets 20. (22 for the other guy i think) and for each level of "fitness" you gain an extra 2. Im currently on the part where the characters split up, one goes to the hardware store, the other to find insulin for a woman i wish i could kill, because i can tell shes going to be a HUGE pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ the quest requires sending a person to grab suppplies from a hardware store BUT UH OH, all the building materials are too heavy to pick up. (even just one apparently ) so not sure what do there.the second issue is ammo and gold for me. this stems hugely from the carry weight issue, i simply cannot carry enough to effectively survive the long run to fort (khorai?) and sell enough to fund a trip back as well as buy the insanely expensive insulin and do quests for the townsfolk. i thought 50 pistol ammo would suffice ( the pistol and its ammo being lightweight allowing for more stuff) but i ran out of ammo for it along the way and got bitten. The third issue is actually a good one. ( that is, one i dont mind too much ) im infected with the blue strain. (so i have a day to cure it) again, wouldnt be a problem if not for the huge lack of carry weight. it really all comes back to that, if i cant carry enougn at the start to effectively survive AND scavange for loot to sell, i cant get enough gold ( the currency) to pay for anything. literally anything. theres stuff too, lots of it. ive been tripping over stuff i know i could seel if i could only afford the space. and then when my ammo ran dry, i ended up stranded in the fort with a bunch of people referring me to the traders whom im convinced must be imaginary or ghosts because ive done 6 laps (literally 6) around the fort trying to find them and i just cant.  . . . that ran too long on tangent.that was actually my fourth issue, a "where is..." chat feature would be a huge help. so i can ask people where to find the traders. it took me 2 laps and 15 minutes to realize that "stranger" wasnt the generic NPC name, it literally meant i had to ask that person's name! i know it sounds like im ripping on the game, and honestly i didnt realize until now that the game wasnt early access but is actually a full game. but in all honesty, i like it. it kept me playing. will i again? yeah, maybe. and maybe i will do better after a few failures. ( those types of games take years for me to actually enjoy, as one failure can turn me off for months depending on the circumstancs) but as it so far stands, i cant honestly recommend it. but thats just me, its my recommendation based on my experience.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
												This is not a complete game. While fun until the refund limit is surpassed, it has it's bugs, cons, and really just isn't finished at all.Pros:- Fun for a couple hours.- Nice quests and controlling aspects.- Interesting stories and quests; don't feel like chores like other games.- Cool window in top right of screen, even though it has no purpose.Cons:- There is no stealth, and zombies just attack you at random.- Building is a pain, and getting resources is far too dangerous and takes too long.- Ammo is far too common and guns far too useless. I'd rather less ammo and gunns not take 30 shots to kill something- Supplying the girl with insulin is impossible.- Constantly tells you what to do, despite being "open-world" ie: "Click to enter" CTL = Control mode etc. like we know...- I feel terribly lazy to do anything that requires walking, as it takes WAY too long and the zombies will always bite you.- Terrible, terrible, disgusting filth of a multiplayer. For the first few hours, there are only 3 characters, the 4th player online will be stuck spectating for HOURS.- The whole game is a tutorial.- Character can't carry practically anything at the start.- No vehicles. Yes, while it IS a zombie post-apocalyptic game, walking feels like MILES between places.- Your bunker is too far away from everything.- Let's just not bring up the whole distance issue again.- Gold is so... complicated? It's not easy but it's not hard to get, but 82 gold for ONE DAY of insulin is just terrible.- Building supplies are far too heavy.- No zoom.Overall Verdict:Would be a fun game if it was early access, in it's current, "complete" state, not worth $5

I know, i know, i'll probably get stoned for that last one but it's just my opinion. I try really hard to see past graphics in games because great graphics does not make a great game. 												This is a phenomenal game. I bought it for $5 to kill time while I was waiting to move overseas and within three days I had 35 hours totalled up. I came close to finishing the game in that time but wasn't able to due to a difficulty in the main campaign where I had to track down a bunch of people to kill them (won't spoil it by saying precisely what).  A couple of them went missing along the way and I couldnt' find them.Initially I thought this was a bug and contacted the dev (who responded VERY quickly and went to a lot of effort to help me).  After sending my save game the dev had a look and told me the location of a few guys still waiting around that I had to track down. I haven't played it since because I'm on a different PC with limited internet, but boy this is a fantastic game, and worth more than $5.Buy it, you won't regret it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												/From the moment you start playing this game, you will get drawn into it!  It's less about mind-blowing graphics and sound than it is about pure enjoyment and strategy.  The role-playing aspects and character stats are well done, and the game is remarkably free of bugs.  Gameplay is smooth, the controls easy, and building and managing a community--while seemingly overwhelming at times--is very satisfying when you do things right.The bottom line: 9/10.  It's like a real-time Jagged Alliance 2 with zombies, and who can argue with that?  Definitely worth a lot more than the price, especially in a world where 99.9999% of modern games fail to live up to the good old days.  This one doesn't, and it's easily fun enough to play through many times over.

												This is probably the best game of the year. They thought of everything, the characters have different personalities, you can try many different ways of playing it. They still could add many things, such as multiplayer communities, different starting characters.. I also expected melee weapons to start with in the start, could have been cool too! I have so much fun playing it and I hope it has or will get the sucess that it deserves. 10/10                                                                     *Fixes*-If you try to complete the game with *Power* after realising you can't win with love, you probably killed Los Ceros already, which is more than 21%, becoming less than 80%. Basically now I have to restart because there isn't enough survivors left for me to recruit and get the quest done.-If you choose to go kill looters with Sarah and do it "Au Naturel", the quest will get permenantly undone for the rest of the game. *Fixed*-When two ais are hungry, or one is thirsty and the other one is hungry, they will start asking eachother for food and water in a loop and it becomes a never ending counter production for the community until they are legit, to tired to ask the other one for food/water!                     *Suggestions that would be great if there were more than one area, (More than one state to travel), and if the game would last longer, more communities and quests etc..*-Traps and animals (Bosses would be cool, at least white strain zombies should drop better loot than green strained zombies..)-Getting a way to increase the survivors skills, maybe adding buildings like Shooting targets, gyms, Hospitals. Send them to shoot targets at the gunstore like Joe Wheeler and the Diabetic girl did would be cool. (Can't remember her name atm)-Asking our scavengers to run back and forth to the resource place would be good, because walking takes way too long.-When our guards shoots down a horde of zombies, we should be able to customise what loot we WANT them to take, what ammo, guns, material, gifts. Which one to bring back to the base, if they find medicine they should go give it to the Survivor titled "Doctor" in the community. Also, it would be great to demand our guards to have a certain amount of ammo, our doctors a certain amount of bandages, our scavengers a maximum amount of "space" they should have.-Ok, that is the most ANNOYING thing in the game. I go really deep in the map, to find a sniper, with Joe Wheeler. A horde of zombies is attacking my base and survivors, so I go to my base and fight them off, but Joe Wheeler decided to go scavenge for food................... He gets attacked by looters and dies, gotta restart to the last saved game.-Since commanding a Survivor to do something becomes a ammo waster, we should be able to ask them that while scavenging, they use a shotgun, while attacking or being attacked by looters, use snipers. Reason is, shotguns are great against zombies and along with  the pistol you shouldn't care about the ammo because you'll never miss any of it. But if they get a sniper, they will spray the zombie and waste 5 bullets on a green strain zombies, like, come on man!-When a farmer is done putting seeds and watering the plants they go guard or scavenge. Reason is that all they do 60% of the time is sitting around doing nothing.-Classify the *Community* tab with  Doctors, scavengers, guards, farmers etc... Once they are titled Doctor, the injured ai will go ask THEM for bandage or w/e unless they can't get there in time they ask someone else. To be titled doctor, you would need to have a doctor suit, etc... (Or make a clinic/hospital where when someone is injured they can go heal there, faster, depending on how many medicine skilled survivors are in it.-Placeable guns on towers so you don't need to give a type of weapon specialised for everyone, ex: Pistol/Sniper/Assault rifle for guards and shotgun for scavengers.-When you command an ai to go scavenge, guard, or what not, if they encounter a zombie, they will waste 4x more ammo than the player would. It's one of the reasons why I hate equiping snipers and assault rifle on my guards because I'll have no ammo later on, but reduce the chances of Los Ceros exterminating me..-Have your gifts change the characteristics of the Survivor. Give a bible: Gets a bit more religious. Unless he rejects it like most unreligious survivor does. -Cigerettes shouldn't give you cancer neither kill you in a couple of days.-I love how other communites have trade routes, adding more 2 resources: water and food, to produce would be great so we could actually trade. *Trees for wood* *Melt rocks for cement* *Metal to barbed wire*... Etc-Automated turrets would be cool, or turrets that could be controlled by the survivor.-Multiplayer, I am leaving that for you to decide how it's going to work, but please don't do a remake of pay to play and play to win Clash of Clans. The reason why I do this review and love the game is because it's worth WAY more than it actually costs.That's all for now, great game, you have to buy it!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 12, 2015
												Okay, so I was hunting around Steam for a relatively cheap game because I had $5 left in my wallet and wanted to make the most of it.I sure did.Survivalist is quite frankly the most modest/fulfilling game I have found in a long time, in all honesty it should be raised to the $7.50-$10 price range, and I shall tell you why soon.Okay so basically TL;DR Survivalist is a post-apocalyptic zombie survival game that orientates you a year after the outbreak, all the whilst you have been barricaded inside a bunker you bought for absolutely no reason (quite coincidental if you ask me). You begin the game exactly one year on as a rich, cheesy character who emerges from his bunker looking for other signs of life, and then the adventure begins.Before I mention about the storyline (I don't want to spoil it so I will only provide vague details) I want to talk about the general gameplay. The closest I can liken the camera angle to is Diablo, fixated roughly birds-eye but angled slightly towards the player. This allows for a good view of the surrounding area, but doesn't impede imersion at all. Your character also follows the direction of your mouse, which is a good quality as you are easily able to pick off zombies as they come screaming towards you. The aiming aspect of the game I believe is unique, yet brilliant; your accuracy is basically zero if you are 'run and gunning' so to be able to kill zombies you need to stay still, juke side to side while plinking them off. The sound is also relatively ambient, however after a fair amount of time the footstep sound can get a little repetitive, but don't get me wrong it definitely adds to the realism of the game. Occasionally you hear the words "Eeeviillll" coming from a zombie somewhere in the close vicinity, but I love this cheesiness considering the game only costs $5, and I have absolutely no problem with it. Although the only aspect of the sound that I consider irritating is when you over-encumber/fatigue; the heavy breathing your character embodies (despite realism) is loud and kind of annoying but oh well, thats a minute flaw in a brilliant game.Now basically this game grasps every concept of a fantastic zombie survival on a minimalistic, but perfect scale. You cannot carry over a certain weight in items, but this can be enlargened through increasing your fitness skill (by running) or by obtaining different backpacks. You have a constant need to find water and food but on top of that ammo is relatively scarce so you need to make use of it considering zombies take a fair amount to bring down. You can also band up with other survivors to create a community, each with different assets like construction/medicine that can help improve your chances to survive. That brings me to the point of base-creation, which in this game is just amazing; you have to collect building resources such as wood and concrete to be able to fence off an area and construct buildings/defenses for a good defense agaisnt the undead. I love this aspect of the game, I didn't expect it to be there at all considering the price but oh boy does it make the difference. However early on you are established as the alpha of the group, and that means catering to the Type-1 Diabetic who requires Insulin constantly, which in this world doesn't come cheap at all. The one thing that really impresses me though is this game is made by a single guy. Just one developer, who hasn't given up on the game (online co-op is in beta now with constant updates) which brings happiness to my heart considering most developers these days give up on early-access. For this guy to be able to create such a simplistic, perfect zombie survival is beyond me, and that is why I believe the price should be raised.I definitely recommend this game 100%, and at this point I only have 3.5 hours but I feel like that number will just skyrocket.

content:
Posted: November 22, 2015
												Love this game.Bad at descriptions so just outline the main bits.Scavange for supplies while fending off zombies. Playing as a character, can freely change between them. Have teammates following you or assign them other tasks. Can take control of someone doing a task and when your inactive they will resume it (I often change between people to sprint for a bit to speed things up).Build up a base, walls to keep zombies out, watch towers and other fun defensive things. Build a well and grow some crops for sustainable food and water.Explore the world, find new places to search for supplies, discover other survivor settlements to trade with and do jobs, bandit camps. Pretty sure there's a city but have barely explored.You can do basically what you like, if you want to kill all the other survivors you can, haven't tried it as I'm nice and they have more guns than me. Can rob, murder or just be rude, probsably won't get you far in life. As only just got it and on first play through I haven't tried out much, having been very nice I got much cheaper prices with some traders.Something I especially love in games in general is having really low system requirements, I like the graphics in Survivalist and it didn't require a computer murdering graphics engine like GTA 5 or watchdogs. I think my 12 year old crappy desktop computer being fossilised under my bed could run this just as well as my gaming PC.athering just fits within their carry capacity with the gear I always have them carry, and so then often cann't carry Definatly think this game is worth more than £4, also I rarely ever see a game with a demo, as its only £4 I considered not bothering to try the demo as I thought it looked so good, don't know how much content is in the demo but I got quite far before deciding I could be downloading the full thing whilst still playing, not that I needed to as the full game downloaded in less than a minute.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2015
												The graphics are a bit simplistic but overall it's a fun game and is quite a bit more in depth than I thought it would be. The base building especially since you can set up literally anywhere on the map. Some places are easier than others due to proximity of resources but if you want to build a base off in the corner of some canyon or ontop of a hill with only one or two entry points that would be easy to defend you can.Combat is fast, though predictable. Each fight basically comes down to trying to keep your stamina high enough to knock away Zombies that grapple you while trying to aim at legs to make them stop running or heads to just kill them quicker. One thing I don't like is there's basically no melee option, the only weapons are guns and there is a limited amount of ammo available even from traders but to be fair it's a hell of a lot, more than enough to finish the story even if you take it slow.You can recruit as many people as you want and build your base as large as you want, your choice between sticking with a small group that's easy to manage or recruiting everyone possible and having a massive compound with farms as far as the eye can see. The advantage to the latter is you can bring a bunch of people with you and totally overwhelm any opposition. I would have liked to see an option to just join one of the other groups instead of always having to fend for yourself though.Out of stamina and get bit? If you have the correct cure for the strain of Zombie that bit you then you're fine, if not you better hope you can find someone who has it in time or that character dies when the infection meter fills up. It adds a bit more challenge and an actual reason to be extra careful when exploring.The other thing I really didn't like was the whole type 1 diabetes thing for one of the characters. I mean, sure, you could just forget about hunting for insulin and let her die right away and not have to deal with it but then you miss out on some very nice free skillups and some story.All in all it's a fun game and worth the couple bucks, especially if you get it on sale.

												This, in my opion, is a beautiful, yet unpolished gem of a video game, its fun, complex, and addictive (for me at least), but it also has it's share of short-comings, there is a real lack of story behind the other communities, I mean, yeah you can get the basic idea, but maybe if you could play as the other community leaders, you could have a complex action to consequence sort of story mode, say if you play as the Reed family, and you all die early on in the game, then you play as Joe later on, there could be ruins where the Reed family would've been, and so on and so on with the other communities. It could also do with some more construction options, as well as more use of insulin, there being only 1 character who uses it just makes it a pain in the butt to get it when you could just kill the character off. It also needs a changing map, the same map over and over again gets kinda boring. I know, I know, I've only been saying bad things so far, but I can't really name all of the great things about this game. Overall, this is a great game with some kinks, but has tons of potential, eventhough the game is finished besides for a patch or 2 after this time. Good job, and hope the sequel is as fun!
